Copied: branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_v/duffy114_2.xml (from rev 598, branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_v/duffy114_1.xml)
===================================================================
--- branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_v/duffy114_1.xml	2007-02-14 00:03:28 UTC (rev 598)
+++ branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_v/duffy114_2.xml	2007-02-20 22:38:31 UTC (rev 605)
@@ -0,0 +1,153 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no" ?>
+<el:level xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://enigma-game.org/schema/level/1 level.xsd" xmlns:el="http://enigma-game.org/schema/level/1">
+  <el:protected>
+    <el:info el:type="level">
+      <el:identity el:title="Plan Ahead" el:subtitle="" el:id="duffy114"/>
+      <el:version el:score="2" el:release="2" el:revision="1" el:status="released"/>
+      <el:author  el:name="Jacob Scott" el:email="" el:homepage=""/>
+      <el:copyright>Copyright ? 2004 Jacob Scott</el:copyright>
+      <el:license el:type="GPL v2.0 or above" el:open="true"/>
+      <el:compatibility el:enigma="0.92">
+      </el:compatibility>
+      <el:modes el:easy="true" el:single="true" el:network="false"/>
+      <el:comments>
+        <el:code>Lua 5.1 and XML converted by Leveladministrators</el:code>
+      </el:comments>
+      <el:score el:easy="-" el:difficult="-"/>
+    </el:info>
+    <el:luamain><![CDATA[
+rooms_wide=1
+rooms_high=1
+
+levelw=1+(19*rooms_wide)
+levelh=1+(12*rooms_high)
+
+create_world( levelw, levelh)
+enigma.ConserveLevel=TRUE
+
+fill_floor("fl-rough-red", 0,0,levelw,levelh)
+
+function renderLine( line, pattern)
+    for i=1, strlen(pattern) do
+        local c = strsub( pattern, i, i)
+        if c =="#" then
+            set_stone( "st-rock1", i-1, line)
+        elseif c =="%" then
+            set_stone( "st-rock1", i-1, line)
+            set_floor("fl-water",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "O" then
+            set_stone("st-oxyd", i-1, line,{color="0"})
+        elseif c == "P" then
+            set_stone("st-oxyd", i-1, line,{color="1"})
+        elseif c == "Q" then
+            set_stone("st-oxyd", i-1, line,{color="2"})
+        elseif c == "`" then
+            set_stone("st-oxyd", i-1, line,{color="3"})
+        elseif c == "^" then
+            set_stone("st-oxyd", i-1, line,{color="4"})
+        elseif c == "." then
+            if not difficult then
+                set_stone("st-oxyd", i-1, line,{color="2"})
+            else
+                set_stone("st-oxyd", i, line,{color="2"})
+                set_stone( "st-rock1", i-1, line)
+            end
+        elseif c == "*" then
+            set_stone( "st-brownie", i-1, line)
+        elseif c == "!" then
+            abyss(i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "~" then
+            set_floor("fl-water",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="z" then
+            set_actor("ac-blackball", i-.5,line+.5, {player=0, essential=1})
+            set_item("it-yinyang",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="y" then
+            if not difficult then
+                set_actor("ac-whiteball", i-1,line+.5, {player=1, essential=1})
+            else
+                set_actor("ac-whiteball", i-.5,line+.5, {player=1, essential=1})
+            end
+        elseif c=="C" then
+            set_item("it-crack3",i-1,line)
+            draw_stones("st-grate1",{i-1,line}, {1,1}, 1)
+        elseif c=="S" then
+            set_item("it-seed",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="B" then
+            set_item("it-bag",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="D" then
+            set_item("it-dynamite",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="h" then
+            set_item("it-hollow",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "g" then
+            draw_stones("st-grate1",{i-1,line}, {1,1}, 1)
+        elseif c == "G" then
+            if difficult==false then
+                --draw_stones("st-grate1",{i-1,line}, {1,1}, 1)
+            else
+                draw_stones("st-grate1",{i-1,line}, {1,1}, 1)
+            end
+        elseif c == "H" then
+            set_stone("st-rock3_break",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "$" then
+            set_stone("st-rock3",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="+" then
+            set_stone( "st-wood", i-1, line)
+        elseif c=="=" then
+            set_floor("fl-space",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="U" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.NORTH})    
+        elseif c=="R" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.EAST})    
+        elseif c=="D" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.SOUTH})    
+        elseif c=="L" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.WEST})
+        elseif c=="u" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway_black", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.NORTH})
+        elseif c=="r" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway_black", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.EAST})
+        elseif c=="d" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway_black", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.SOUTH})
+        elseif c=="l" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway_black", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.WEST})
+        elseif c=="w" then
+            set_stone("st-oneway_white", i-1,line, {orientation=enigma.WEST})
+        elseif c=="Z" then
+            yy1( "black",  i-1, line)
+        elseif c=="Y" then
+            yy1( "white",  i-1, line)
+            if not difficult then
+                set_item("it-yinyang",i-1,line)
+            end
+        elseif c=="q" then
+            yy1( "white",  i-1, line)
+        end
+    end    
+end
+
+function yy1( color, x, y)
+    stone = format( "st-%s4", color)
+    set_stone( stone, x, y)
+end
+
+renderLine(00,"####################")
+renderLine(01,"###    ######   SZO#")
+renderLine(02,"#Dw    lCCCCl   SZZ#")
+renderLine(03,"### qqq######    ZZ#")
+renderLine(04,"#O  qhH######Hh  ZP#")
+renderLine(05,"#P  qhH~~~~~ZHh  ZZ#")
+renderLine(06,"#. yqhH~~~~~ZHhBzSYQ")
+renderLine(07,"#`  qhH~~~~~ZHh  ZZ#")
+renderLine(08,"#^  qhH######Hh  Z`#")
+renderLine(09,"### qqq######    ZZ#")
+renderLine(10,"#Dl    rCCCCr   SZZ#")
+renderLine(11,"###    ######   SZ^#")
+renderLine(12,"####################")
+    ]]></el:luamain>
+    <el:i18n>
+      <el:string el:key="title">
+        <el:english el:translate="false"/>
+      </el:string>
+    </el:i18n>
+  </el:protected>
+</el:level>

--- branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_v/duffy133_1.xml	2007-02-14 00:03:28 UTC (rev 598)

@@ -0,0 +1,124 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no" ?>
+<el:level xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://enigma-game.org/schema/level/1 level.xsd" xmlns:el="http://enigma-game.org/schema/level/1">
+  <el:protected>
+    <el:info el:type="level">
+      <el:identity el:title="Humid Maze" el:subtitle="" el:id="duffy133"/>
+      <el:version el:score="2" el:release="2" el:revision="1" el:status="released"/>
+      <el:author  el:name="Jacob Scott" el:email="" el:homepage=""/>
+      <el:copyright>Copyright ? 2005 Jacob Scott</el:copyright>
+      <el:license el:type="GPL v2.0 or above" el:open="true"/>
+      <el:compatibility el:enigma="0.92">
+      </el:compatibility>
+      <el:modes el:easy="true" el:single="true" el:network="false"/>
+      <el:comments>
+        <el:code>Lua 5.1 and XML converted by Leveladministrators</el:code>
+      </el:comments>
+      <el:score el:easy="-" el:difficult="-"/>
+    </el:info>
+    <el:luamain><![CDATA[
+rooms_wide=4
+rooms_high=3
+
+levelw=1+(19*rooms_wide)
+levelh=1+(12*rooms_high)
+
+create_world( levelw, levelh)
+enigma.WaterSinkSpeed=0.15
+enigma.SwampSinkSpeed=0.5
+
+fill_floor("fl-hay", 0,0,levelw,levelh)
+
+function renderLine( line, pattern)
+    for i=1, strlen(pattern) do
+        local c = strsub( pattern, i, i)
+        if c =="#" then
+            set_stone("st-invisible",i-1,line)
+            abyss(i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "o" then
+            oxyd( i-1, line)
+            set_floor("fl-water",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "*" then
+            set_stone( "st-brownie", i-1, line)
+        elseif c == "!" then
+            abyss(i-1,line)
+        elseif c == " " then
+            abyss(i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "~" then
+            set_floor("fl-water",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "S" then
+            set_floor("fl-swamp",i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="z" then
+            set_actor("ac-blackball", i-.5,line+.5, {player=0})
+            set_floor("fl-swamp",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "g" then
+            draw_stones("st-grate1",{i-1,line}, {1,1}, 1)
+        elseif c=="+" then
+            set_stone( "st-wood", i-1, line)
+        elseif c=="=" then
+            set_floor("fl-space",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "F" then
+            set_item("it-flagblack",i-1,line)
+            set_floor("fl-swamp",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "s" then
+            if not difficult then
+                set_item("it-seed",i-1,line)
+            end
+            set_floor("fl-swamp",i-1,line)
+        elseif c == "O" then
+            if not difficult then
+                set_item("it-extralife",i-1,line)
+            end
+            set_floor("fl-swamp",i-1,line)
+        end
+    end    
+end
+
+renderLine(00,"#############################################################################")
+renderLine(01,"#                                                                           #")
+renderLine(02,"# ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~    ~~~~~   ~~~~ #")
+renderLine(03,"#           ~                ~                ~           ~   SSS  ~~~~~  ~ #")
+renderLine(04,"# ~~~~~~~~  ~  ~~~~~~~~~~~~  ~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~ ~ ~~~~~~~   ~  SSSS         ~ #")
+renderLine(05,"# ~      ~~~~  ~          ~  ~          ~ ~   ~ ~     ~   ~ SSSSS ~~~ ~~~~~ #")
+renderLine(06,"# ~  SSS       ~   ~~~~~~ ~ SS ~~~~~~~~ ~ ~~~~~ ~ ~~~ ~   ~ SSSSS ~   ~     #")
+renderLine(07,"# ~ SSSSS~~~~~~~   ~    ~ ~ SS ~      ~ ~ ~     ~ ~ ~ ~   ~     ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(08,"# ~ SSSS       ~   ~    ~ ~ SS ~  ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~~~ ~ ~ ~   ~ ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(09,"# ~ SSSS ~~~~~ ~   ~ ~~~~ ~ SS ~  ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~     ~ ~ ~   ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(10,"# ~      ~   ~ ~   ~ ~    ~    ~  ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~~~ ~ ~ ~       ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(11,"# ~~~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~   ~ ~ ~~~~~~~~~  ~ ~ ~ ~ ~       ~ ~ ~   ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(12,"# ~        ~ ~ ~   ~ ~ ~       ~  ~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~~~~~~~ ~ ~   ~ ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(13,"# ~~~~~~~~~~ ~ ~~~~~ ~ ~ ~~~~~ ~  ~   ~ ~    ~    ~ ~ ~   ~     ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(14,"#            ~     ~ ~ ~ ~   ~ ~~ ~ ~~~ ~   ~~  ~ ~ ~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(15,"# SS~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~ ~  ~ ~     ~   ~   ~ ~ ~               ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(16,"# SSS      ~ ~   ~ ~ ~ ~   ~ ~  ~ ~~~~~~~~  ~~  ~ ~ ~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(17,"# SSSS ~~~ ~ ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~ ~ ~~        ~~  ~  ~ ~           ~       ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(18,"# SSSS ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~   ~ ~ ~   ~ ~    SSOS  ~~ ~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~ ~       ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(19,"#  SSS ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~ ~ ~ ~~~ ~ ~~~~~SSSFS  ~            ~   ~ ~ ~~~~~~~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(20,"#    ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~   ~ ~ ~   ~ ~      SSSSzS ~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~ ~ ~       ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(21,"#        ~ ~ ~ ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~ ~ ~~~~  SsSSS ~ ~ooo~            ~ ~ ~~~~~~~ ~ #")
+renderLine(22,"# ~~~~~~~~ ~ ~   ~ ~ ~ ~ ~   ~    ~     ~  ~ ~ooo~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(23,"# ~      ~ ~ ~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~  ~ ~~~~~ ~            ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(24,"# ~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~     ~               ~       ~   ~~~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(25,"# ~      ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~~~ ~   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   ~      ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(26,"# ~ ~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~     ~     ~                       ~  SSS ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(27,"# ~        ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ SSSSSSS ~   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  ~ SSSS ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(28,"# ~~~~~~~~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ SSSSSSS ~~~~~                ~  ~ SSSS ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~~~ #")
+renderLine(29,"#        ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~  SSS            ~~~~~~~~~~~  ~  ~ SSSS ~ ~ ~ ~     ~ #")
+renderLine(30,"# ~~~~~~~~ ~     ~   ~    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~         ~~~~  ~   ~  ~ ~ ~ ~~~~~ ~ #")
+renderLine(31,"# ~        ~~~~~~~~~~~              ~    ~~~~~~~       ~   ~  ~ ~       ~ ~ #")
+renderLine(32,"# ~~~~~~~~                 ~~~~~~~  ~~~~~~     ~~~~~~~~~   ~  ~ ~~~~~~~~~ ~ #")
+renderLine(33,"# ~        ~~~   ~~~~~     ~     ~         ~~~             ~              ~ #")
+renderLine(34,"# ~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~   ~~~~~~~     ~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #")
+renderLine(35,"#                                                                           #")
+renderLine(36,"#############################################################################")
+
+oxyd_shuffle()
+
+display.SetFollowMode(display.FOLLOW_SCROLLING)
+    ]]></el:luamain>
+    <el:i18n>
+      <el:string el:key="title">
+        <el:english el:translate="false"/>
+      </el:string>
+    </el:i18n>
+  </el:protected>
+</el:level>

+-- !!BBE105!! Do not delete this line
+
+function file_oxyd(x,y,f)
+    oxyd_default_flavor=f
+    oxyd(x,y)
+end
+
+levelh=13
+levelw=20
+
+cells={}
+stones={}
+
+stones[" "]=cell{}
+cells[" "]=cell{}
+
+cells["!"]=cell{floor="fl-normal"}
+if difficult then
+    stones["!"]=cell{stone="st-fart"}
+else
+    stones["!"]=cell{stone="st-likeoxydb"}
+end
+stones["#"]=cell{parent={{file_oxyd,"b"}}}
+level={"!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"}
+stmap={"!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!",
+       "!                  !",
+       "!                  !",
+       "!                  !",
+       "!       #  #       !",
+       "!      #    #      !",
+       "!     #      #     !",
+       "!    #        #    !",
+       "!   #          #   !",
+       "!  #            #  !",
+       "! #              # !",
+       "!#                #!",
+       "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"}
+
+create_world_by_map(level)
+draw_map(0,0,stmap,stones)
+
+set_actor("ac-blackball",10.5,1.5,{player=0,name="bb"})
+set_actor("ac-rotor",4.5,11.5,{range=20,force=20,name="rot1",gohome=TRUE})
+set_actor("ac-rotor",15.5,11.5,{range=20,force=20,name="rot2",gohome=TRUE})
+
+AddRubberBand(enigma.GetNamedObject("bb"),enigma.GetNamedObject("rot1"),10,100)
+AddRubberBand(enigma.GetNamedObject("bb"),enigma.GetNamedObject("rot2"),10,100)
+set_item("it-document",10,1,{text="text1"})
+oxyd_shuffle()

Copied: branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_vi/alain25_2.xml (from rev 598, branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_vi/alain25_1.xml)
===================================================================
--- branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_vi/alain25_1.xml	2007-02-14 00:03:28 UTC (rev 598)
+++ branches/1.0/data/levels/enigma_vi/alain25_2.xml	2007-02-20 22:38:31 UTC (rev 605)
@@ -0,0 +1,148 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no" ?>
+<el:level xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://enigma-game.org/schema/level/1 level.xsd" xmlns:el="http://enigma-game.org/schema/level/1">
+  <el:protected>
+    <el:info el:type="level">
+      <el:identity el:title="- Meditation -" el:subtitle="Pauli" el:id="alain25"/>
+      <el:version el:score="2" el:release="2" el:revision="1" el:status="released"/>
+      <el:author  el:name="Alain Busser + Raoul Bourquin" el:email="" el:homepage=""/>
+      <el:copyright>Copyright ? 2006 Alain Busser + Raoul Bourquin</el:copyright>
+      <el:license el:type="GPL v2.0 or above" el:open="true"/>
+      <el:compatibility el:enigma="0.92">
+      </el:compatibility>
+      <el:modes el:easy="true" el:single="true" el:network="false"/>
+      <el:comments>
+        <el:code>Lua 5.1 and XML converted by Leveladministrators</el:code>
+      </el:comments>
+      <el:score el:easy="-" el:difficult="1:54"/>
+    </el:info>
+    <el:luamain><![CDATA[
+levelw = 20
+levelh = 13
+
+nhol=8
+
+create_world(levelw, levelh)
+oxyd_default_flavor = "a"
+display.SetFollowMode(display.FOLLOW_SCROLLING)
+fill_floor("fl-leaves", 0,0, level_width,level_height)
+draw_border("st-rock1")
+
+function renderLine( line, pattern)
+    for i=1, strlen(pattern) do
+        local c = strsub( pattern, i, i)
+        if c =="#" then
+            set_item("it-hollow", i-1, line)
+        elseif c=="*" then
+            set_item("it-trigger",i-1,line,{invisible=1,action="callback",target="mix"})
+            --set_floor("fl-leavesb",i-1,line)
+            circle(i-1,line)
+        elseif c=="z" then
+            set_actor("ac-whiteball-small", i-.5,line+.5, {player=0})
+        end
+    end    
+end
+
+function mix()
+    for i=0,3 do
+        for j=0,2 do
+            for k=0,3 do
+                enigma.KillItem(5*i+j+1,k+1)
+                enigma.KillItem(5*i+j+1,k+8)
+            end
+        end
+    end
+    spade()
+end
+
+function spade()
+    holi[1]=random(4)-1
+    holj[1]=random(3)-1
+    holk[1]=random(4)-1
+    holl[1]=random(2)-1
+    for n=2,nhol do
+        repeat
+            ii=random(4)-1
+            jj=random(3)-1
+            kk=random(4)-1
+            ll=random(2)-1
+            vazy=1
+            m = 0
+            for p=1,n do
+                if holi[p]==ii and holj[p]==jj and holk[p]==kk and holl[p]==ll then
+                    vazy=0
+                end
+                if vazy==0 then
+                    m=m+1
+                end
+            end
+        until m == 0
+        holi[n]=ii
+        holj[n]=jj
+        holk[n]=kk
+        holl[n]=ll
+    end
+    for n=1,nhol do
+        set_item("it-hollow",5*holi[n]+holj[n]+1,holk[n]+7*holl[n]+1)
+    end
+end
+
+--draw the green circles:
+function circle(x,y)
+    t=random(1,4)
+    if t==1 then
+        xk=x
+        yk=y
+    elseif t==2 then
+        xk=x-1
+        yk=y
+    elseif t==3 then
+        xk=x-1
+        yk=y-1
+    elseif t==4 then
+        xk=x
+        yk=y-1
+    end
+ 
+    if difficult then
+        set_floor("fl-leavesd1",xk,yk)
+        set_floor("fl-leavesd3",xk+1,yk)
+        set_floor("fl-leavesd2",xk,yk+1)
+        set_floor("fl-leavesd4",xk+1,yk+1)
+    else
+        set_floor("fl-leavesc4",xk,yk)
+        set_floor("fl-leavesc2",xk+1,yk)
+        set_floor("fl-leavesc3",xk,yk+1)
+        set_floor("fl-leavesc1",xk+1,yk+1)
+    end
+end
+
+--               01234567890123456789
+renderLine(00 , "                    ")
+renderLine(01 , "    *    *    *     ")
+renderLine(02 , "                    ")
+renderLine(03 , "    *    *    *     ")
+renderLine(04 , "                    ")  
+renderLine(05 , "  *  z  *   *  z  * ")
+renderLine(06 , " *  z z       z z   ")
+renderLine(07 , "  *  z  *   *  z  * ")
+renderLine(08 , "                    ")
+renderLine(09 , "     *    *    *    ")
+renderLine(10 , "                    ")
+renderLine(11 , "     *    *    *    ")
+renderLine(12 , "                    ")
+--               012345678901234567890
+
+holi={}
+holj={}
+holk={}
+holl={}
+mix()
+oxyd_shuffle()
+    ]]></el:luamain>
+    <el:i18n>
+      <el:string el:key="title">
+        <el:english el:translate="false"/>
+      </el:string>
+    </el:i18n>
+  </el:protected>
+</el:level>

 <h3>Wichtigste Features</h3>

+<li>Mehr als 900 verschiedene Levels garantieren lang anhaltende Unterhaltung.
+<li>Stabile Version 1.00 mit mehr als 200'000 Downloads in 2 Monaten.
+<li>&Uuml;bersetzt in folgende Sprachen:<br/>

Added: homepage/news/news_issue16_de.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/news/news_issue16_de.html	2007-02-20 23:03:30 UTC (rev 606)
+++ homepage/news/news_issue16_de.html	2007-02-21 02:05:21 UTC (rev 607)
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+<h3 class="news">
+    <span class="date">Dec 13 2006: </span> Enigma 1.00 Released <font color="red">NEU!</font>
+</h3>
+
+<p>Die neue stabile Version von Enigma wurde genau 555 Tage nach der
+    letzten stabilen Version ver&ouml;ffentlicht. Doch das Warten hat sich
+    definitiv gelohnt. Die Liste der neuen oder verbesserten Features schliesst
+    Folgendes ein:</p>
+
+<ul>
+    <li> 200 neue Level (inzwischen insgesamt mehr als 970!)
+    <li> Neue Gruppierung der Levelpacks
+    <li> Drop & play von neuen Levels und Levelpacks
+    <li> Level inspector mit Bewertungen und Statistiken f&uuml;r jedes Level
+    <li> Screenshot Betrachter
+    <li> Pers&ouml;nliche Bemerkungen und Bewertungen von Levels m&ouml;glich
+    <li> &Uuml;bersetzungen der Leveltitel und Dokumente
+    <li> Neue Sprachen: Schwedisch, Russisch, Ungarisch, Portugiesisch
+    <li> Unz&auml;hlige kleinere Verbesserungen
+</ul>
+  
+<p>Mit 1.00 besitzt jedes Level neben dem Weltrekord Statistiken u.a. zum durchschnittlichen
+    Rating und der Zahl der Spieler, die es gel&ouml;st haben. Diese Daten sind von Ihrem
+    Feedback abh&auml;ngig. Bitte unterst&uuml;tzten sie dieses neue Feature, indem
+    Sie uns Ihre Spieldaten wie in <a href="scores.html">Spielergebnisse einsenden</a>
+    beschrieben zur&uuml;ckschicken.</p>
+  
+<p>Wie &uuml;blich ist die neue Version auf der <a href="download.html">Downloadseite</a> erh&auml;ltlich. (<font color="red">Mac OS X nun auch verf&uuml;gbar!</font>).</p>
+
+<p>Viel Spass!</p>

+</p>

+function parse_text(v, text, lang, context)
+    return string.gsub(text, "%$%$(.-)%$%$", function (s)

+function parse_html(v, infilename0, lang)
+    if not infilename0 then
+        error("Error during creation of "..v.title..": Expected filename, got nil.")
+    end
+
+    -- Open infile dependend relative to lang, use English as fallback.
+
+    local infilename = add_lang_to_filename(infilename0, lang)
+    local infile = io.open(infilename, "r")
+    if infile == nil then
+        infile = io.open(infilename0, "r")
+        if infile == nil then
+            error("Error: Neither "..infilename.." nor "..infilename0.." exist.")
+        else        
+            io.write ("No file "..infilename..", using fallback "..infilename0.."...\n")
+            infilename = infilename0
+        end
+    else
+        io.write ("Reading input from "..infilename.." ...\n")
+    end
+
+    -- Read and process infile
+
+    local body = infile:read("*a")
+    infile:close()
+    return parse_text(v, body, lang, infilename)
+end
+
 -- First create the two news-files
 
 dofile("news/read_news.lua")

+<h3 class="news">
+    <span class="date">Jan 02 2005: </span>
+    Internet-Forum f&uuml;r Enigma
+</h3>
+
+<p>Dank der unerm&uuml;dlichen Anstrengungen von &#34;illmind&#34; haben wir
+    nun ein <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">Internet-Forum</a> f&uuml;r
+    Enigma und BlackBallEd, den Enigma-Level-Editor. Falls Sie einige Tipps
+    f&uuml;r bestimmte Level suchen oder Ideen und Levels austauschen
+    m&ouml;chten, ist dies der richtige Ort damit zu beginnen.
+</p>

Added: homepage/news/news_issue11_de.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/news/news_issue11_de.html	2007-02-22 21:23:21 UTC (rev 608)
+++ homepage/news/news_issue11_de.html	2007-02-22 22:54:52 UTC (rev 609)
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<h3 class="news">
+    <span class="date">Apr 20 2005: </span> Enigma 0.90 ver&ouml;ffentlicht
+</h3>
+
+<p>Die neue stabile Version von Enigma wurde nun ver&ouml;ffentlicht, nach
+    einer Entwicklungszeit von mehr als 18 Monaten. Die Liste der neuen und
+    verbesserten Features umfasst:
+</p>
+
+<ul>
+    <li> Viele neue Level (jetzt mehr als 750 insgesamt)
+    <li> Unterst&uuml;tzung der Aufl&ouml;sungen 800x600 und 1024x768
+    <li> Unterst&uuml;tzung von nicht-englischen &Uuml;bersetzungen
+    <li> Stark verbesserte Oxyd 1- und Per.Oxyd-Kompatibilit&auml;t
+    <li> Neu designtes Optionsmen&uuml;
+    <li> Zahllose kleine Verbesserungen
+</ul>

Added: homepage/news/news_issue12_de.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/news/news_issue12_de.html	2007-02-22 21:23:21 UTC (rev 608)
+++ homepage/news/news_issue12_de.html	2007-02-22 22:54:52 UTC (rev 609)
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+<h3 class="news">
+    <span class="date">Apr 26 2005: </span> Enigma 0.91 ver&ouml;ffentlicht
+</h3>
+
+<p>Wie immer tauchten ein paar unerwartete Fehler kurz nach der letzten
+    &#34;stabilen&#34; Version auf. Mit Enigma 0.91 wurden die folgenden
+    Probleme aus Enigma 0.90 repariert:</p>
+
+<ul>
+    <li>Falls Sie die 640x512-Aufl&ouml;sung in Enigma 0.81 verwendet haben,
+        betritt das Spiel nun nicht mehr in eine Endlosschleife nach dem Laden
+        der Spieldaten.
+    <li>Alle Levelpakete sind aus dem Men&uuml; heraus sichtbar, statt nur
+        &quot;Tutorial&quot; und &quot;Sokoban&quot;.
+
+    <li>Plus einigen kleineren Problemen, die den meisten Nutzern sicherlich
+        nicht aufgefallen sind.
+</ul>

Modified: homepage/news/news_issue12_en.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/news/news_issue12_en.html	2007-02-22 21:23:21 UTC (rev 608)
+++ homepage/news/news_issue12_en.html	2007-02-22 22:54:52 UTC (rev 609)
@@ -11,7 +11,7 @@
         doesn't enter an endless loop any more after after loading the game
         data.
     <li>All level packs are visible in the menu, instead of only
-        "Tutorial" and "Sokoban".
+        &quot;Tutorial&quot; and &quot;Sokoban&quot;.
 
     <li>Plus a few smaller problems that most users won't have
         noticed.

+++ homepage/news/news_issue15_de.html	2007-02-22 22:54:52 UTC (rev 609)
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+<h3 class="news">
+    <span class="date">Nov 22 2006: </span> Enigma 1.00 Beta ver&ouml;ffentlicht
+</h3>
+
+<p>Ich freue mich, nach einer langen Pause das erste &ouml;ffentliche
+    Test-Release von Enigma seit mehr als einem Jahr anzuk&uuml;ndigen. Es ist
+    verf&uuml;gbar aud der <a
+    href="$$download$$#unstable">Download-Seite</a>. Da der Zweck eines
+    Test-Releases das Finden und Reparieren von m&ouml;glichst vielen Fehlern
+    ist, berichten Sie bitte alle Fehler, die Sie finden, an die <a
+    href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">Enigma-Mailingliste</a>.
+</p>
+
+<p>Gleichzeitig erf&uuml;llt diese Version den Zweck, Spielergebnisse f&uuml;r
+    die Auswertung unserer Statistiken einzusammeln und die Weltrekordliste
+    auf neuestem Stand zu halten. Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre Score-Datei nach
+    einem Update zu 1.00 Beta wie beschrieben in <a
+    href="$$scores$$">Spielergebnisse einsenden</a> zu.
+</p>

@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<h3 class="news">
+    <span class="date">Okt 12 2003: </span>
+    Enigma 0.81 ver&ouml;ffentlicht
+</h3>
+
+<p>Diese Version korrigiert einige Probleme, die in Version 0.80 aufgetaucht
+    sind. Insbesondere werden Levels nicht automatisch neu gestartet, wenn man
+    eine Murmel verliert.</p>
+  
+<p>Gerade jetzt sind nur der Quellcode und ein Installer f&uuml;r Windows
+    verf&uuml;gbar; Pakete f&uuml;r andere Betriebssysteme werden in den
+    n&auml;chsten Tagen oder Wochen folgen.</p>
+  
+<ul>
+    <li>Detaillierte Liste der &Auml;nderungen
+    <li><a href="$$download$$">Download</a>
+</ul>

@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+<h3 class="news">
+    <span class="date">Jan 05 2004: </span>
+    Download-Probleme
+</h3>
+
+<p>Wie Ihnen vielleicht aufgefallen ist, funktionieren die Links auf der
+Download-Seite aktuell nicht. Kurzfristig stehen einige der Pakete auf meiner
+pers&ouml;nlichen Homepage zur Verf&uuml;gung. Wir erwarten, dass der
+Haupt-Download-Server in einigen Wochen wieder zur&uuml;ck ist, und hoffen,
+Enigma 0.90 dann bald darauf ver&ouml;ffentlichen zu k&ouml;nnen. Bleiben Sie
+also dran!
+</p>

+</h3>
+

+Test-Release von Enigma seit mehr als einem Jahr ank&uuml;ndigen zu
+k&ouml;nnen. Es ist verf&uuml;gbar auf der <a
+href="$$download$$#unstable">Download-Seite</a>. 
+Da der Zweck eines Test-Releases das Finden und Reparieren von m&ouml;glichst
+vielen Fehlern wie m&ouml;glich ist, berichten Sie bitte alle Fehler, die Sie
+finden auf der <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">Enigma-Mailingliste
+</a>.  Viel Spa&szlig;!
+</p>

-<h3><a name="stable">Stable Release (Version 1.00)</a></h3>
+<h2>Get Enigma</h2>
 
-<p>Please report problems with any of these packages to the <a

+All links and some hints for downloading Enigma are provided on this page sorted
+by the following critera:
+
 <ul>
-<li> Windows '95 and later
+  <li><a href="$$download$$#stable">Stable Release</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.
+  <li><a href="$$download$$#compilation">Compilation from Sourcecode</a> - Hints for Unix. 
+  <li><a href="$$download$$#announce">Announce Maillist</a> - Get a mail notification on new Enigma releases.

+
+  <p>Besides &apos;Full&apos; packages we provide size reduzed 'Minimum' packages
+  for users with a low bandwidth. 'Minimum' and 'Source' packages do not include
+  the 'Previews' package. The packages are still complete as missing previews
+  are generate on the fly at the cost of a few seconds at the first level menu
+  calls.</p>

+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="compilation">Compiling from Source Code under Unix</a></h3>
+
+  <p>In case your Unix distribution does not provide Enigma packages you may
+  want to download the source package and compile Enigma for your own. This
+  is usually a simple straight forward task.</p>
+  
+  <p>Enigma depends on a few libraries and tools. Most Unix systems come with
+  these libraries pre-installed these days.  But for compilation you may need
+  additional &apos;-devel&apos; packages besides the runtime packages of the
+  libraries.  Please verify that the libraries SDL, SDL_ttf, SDL_image, SDL_mixer
+  and Xerces are installed on your system.</p>
+  
+  <p>For a complete list of libraries and programs that must be installed to
+  compile Enigma, please refer to the file &apos;doc/REQUIREMENTS&apos; that is
+  included in the Enigma source package.</p>
+
+  <p>Once you have everything installed, building Enigma is as easy as typing
+
+   <pre>./configure && make && make install</pre>
+
+  in the enigma directory.</p>
+  
+  <p>If your distribution does not provide the necessary packages, you can
+  download them from the following web sites:</p>
+
+  <ul>
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org">SDL</a>&emsp;(&ge; 1.2)
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_ttf">SDL_ttf</a>&emsp;(&ge; 2.0.6)
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_mixer">SDL_mixer</a>&emsp;
+      (&ge; 1.2.4)
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_image">SDL_image</a>&emsp;
+      (&ge; 1.2.0)
+    <li><a href="http://xml.apache.org/xerces-c">Xerces</a>&emsp;(&ge; 2.4)
+  </ul>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="announce">Announce Maillist</a></h3>
+
+If your are keen on being up to date on Enigma we offer an annoucement service
+for new releases via email. Just register yourself on the 
+<a href="http://lists.nongnu.org/mailman/listinfo/enigma-announce">announce 
+maillist</a>. The mail volume is limited to one mail per beta or final relase
+version of Enigma, which did not yet exceed half a dozen mails per year.
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="devel">Development version</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Interested in the leading edge development version of Enigma?
+  Enigma's development version can be downloaded from its source code
+  repository. 
+  <pre>svn://svn.berlios.de/enigma-game</pre>
+  Please refer to the <a href="$$development$$">development
+  page</a> for detailed instructions.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="oldversions">Old versions</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Due to changes in source code repository and download servers old versions
+  of Enigma can be found on different servers. Have a look at
+  <ul>
+  <li><a href="http://developer.berlios.de/project/showfiles.php?group_id=3972">
+    Berlios</a>&emsp;for recent releases.</li>
+  <li><a href="http://savannah.nongnu.org/download/enigma/">
+    http://savannah.nongnu.org/download/enigma/</a>&emsp;for previous releases</li>
+  <li><a href="http://www.mag-heut.net/blackball/index.php?act=ST&f=2&t=118&s=1b5eee7f424b7bd5f9ef75e927a549e9">
+    mag-heut.net</a>&emsp;for old Windows versions.</li>
+  </ul>
+

From andreasl at mail.berlios.de  Sat Feb 24 00:54:44 2007
From: andreasl at mail.berlios.de (andreasl at BerliOS)
Date: Sat, 24 Feb 2007 00:54:44 +0100
Subject: [Enigma-game-svn] r611 - branches/1.0/src
Message-ID: <200702232354.l1NNsi0f008621@sheep.berlios.de>

Author: andreasl
Date: 2007-02-24 00:54:42 +0100 (Sat, 24 Feb 2007)
New Revision: 611

Modified:
   branches/1.0/src/stones_complex.cc
   branches/1.0/src/world.cc
Log:
Fixing turnstile border crash:
 - Pushing an actor out of the level grid with a turnstile
   is replaced by a shatter instead (no warp).
 - Other methods to warp an actor out of the level grid are
   throw an XLevelRuntime-Exception in "world::WarpActor".
Small changes to turnstile code:
 - 135 degree-warp when hitting pivot and arm at once.
 - Removed unused turnstile-corner-code.

 void world::WarpActor(Actor *a, double newx, double newy, bool keep_velocity)

+        "WarpActor: Tried to warp actor out of level grid. (And hyperspace travel is not implemented yet, sorry.)");

-<h3>Compiling from Source Code under Linux</h3>
-
-<p>Enigma depends on four additional libraries: SDL, SDL_ttf,
-SDL_image, and SDL_mixer.  Most GNU/Linux systems come with these
-libraries pre-installed these days.  You may need '-devel' versions of
-these packages if you intend to compile Enigma from source.  If your
-distribution does not provide the necessary packages, you can download
-them from the following web sites:</p>
-
-<ul>
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org">SDL</a> (&gt;= 1.2)
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_ttf">SDL_ttf</a>
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_mixer">SDL_mixer</a>
-      (&gt;= 1.2.4)
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_image">SDL_image</a>
-      (&gt;= 1.2.0)
-  <li>Xerces
-</ul>
-

-<h3>Quellcode kompilieren unter Linux</h3>
-
-<p>Enigma ben&ouml;tigt vier zus&auml;tzliche Bibliotheken: SDL, SDL_ttf,
-SDL_image, and SDL_mixer. Die meisten heutigen GNU/Linux-Systeme enthalten
-diese Bibliotheken bereits. Sie ben&ouml;tigen aber zus&auml;tzliche die
-'-devel'-Versionen dieser Pakete, falls Sie vorhaben, Enigma zu
-kompilieren. Falls Ihre Distribution nicht die n&ouml;tigen Pakete anbietet,
-k&ouml;nnen Sie sie von den folgenden Webseiten herunterladen:</p>
-
-<ul>
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org">SDL</a> (&gt;= 1.2)
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_ttf">SDL_ttf</a>
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_mixer">SDL_mixer</a>
-      (&gt;= 1.2.4)
-  <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_image">SDL_image</a>
-      (&gt;= 1.2.0)
-  <li>Xerces
-</ul>
-
-<h4>Beispiel f&uuml;r Debian GNU/Linux</h4>
-
-<p>Die oben genannten Abh&auml;ngigkeiten k&ouml;nnen bei Debian bequem &uuml;ber das 
-Packetverwaltungssystem (aptitude, apt ...) instaliert werden.</p>

-href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">Enigma Mailing-Liste</a>. </p>
+S&auml;mtliche Links und einige Hinweise um Enigma herunterzuladen sind auf
+dieser Seite nach folgenden Kategorien sortiert:

+  Pakete - beginnen Sie hier.

+  kleinere 'minimale' Pakete f&uuml;r User mit geringerer Bandbreite
+  (z.B. Modem) zur Verf&uuml;gung. 'Minimale' and 'Quelltext-Pakete' enthalten
+  nicht das 'Vorschaubilder'-Paket. Sie sind dennoch vollst&auml;ndig, da
+  fehlende Vorschaubilder direkt in Enigma erzeugt werden, was lediglich ein
+  paar Sekunden bei den ersten Aufrufen des Levelmen&uuml;s kostet.</p>

-Levelvorschau-Bilder. Allerdings werden fehlende Vorschau-Bilder direkt in

+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="compilation">Quellcode kompilieren unter Unix</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Falls es f&uuml;r Ihre Unix-Distribution keine Enigma-Pakete gibt,
+  m&ouml;chten Sie vielleicht die Quellpakete herunterladen und Enigma selbst
+  kompilieren. Dies ist normalerweise ziemlich einfach.</p>
+  
+  <p>Enigma h&auml;ngt von einigen Bibliotheken und Werkzeugen ab. Die meisten
+  Unix-Systeme enthalten heutzutage diese Bibliotheken bereits von Anfang
+  an. Aber f&uuml;rs Kompilieren ben&ouml;tigen Sie zus&auml;tzlich
+  &apos;-devel&apos;-Pakete neben den &uuml;blichen Laufzeit-Paketen. Bitte
+  stellen Sie sicher, dass die Bibliotheken SDL, SDL_ttf, SDL_image, SDL_mixer
+  und Xerces auf Ihrem System installiert sind.</p>
+  
+  <p>F&uuml;r eine vollst&auml;ndige Liste aller Bibliotheken und Programme,
+  die f&uuml;rs Kompilieren ben&ouml;tigt werden, lesen Sie bitte die Datei
+  &apos;doc/REQUIREMENTS&apos; im Enigma-Quelltext-Paket.</p>
+
+  <p>Sobald Sie alles installiert haben, geschieht das Kompilieren einfach
+  durch
+
+   <pre>./configure && make && make install</pre>
+
+  im Enigma-Verzeichnis.</p>
+  
+  <p>Falls die ben&ouml;tigten Pakete nicht in Ihrer Distribution enthalten
+  sind, k&ouml;nnen Sie sie auch auf den folgenden Seiten herunterladen:</p>
+
+  <ul>
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org">SDL</a>&emsp;(&ge; 1.2)
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_ttf">SDL_ttf</a>&emsp;(&ge; 2.0.6)
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_mixer">SDL_mixer</a>&emsp;
+      (&ge; 1.2.4)
+    <li><a href="http://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_image">SDL_image</a>&emsp;
+      (&ge; 1.2.0)
+    <li><a href="http://xml.apache.org/xerces-c">Xerces</a>&emsp;(&ge; 2.4)
+  </ul>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="announce">Ank&uuml;ndigungs-Mailingliste</a></h3>
+
+Damit Sie stets auf dem neuesten Stand sein k&ouml;nnen, wenn eine neue
+Version von Enigma erscheint, bieten wir einen Benachrichtigungsservice via
+Email an. Tragen Sie sich daf&uuml;r auf unserer
+<a href="http://lists.nongnu.org/mailman/listinfo/enigma-announce"
+>Ank&uuml;ndigungs-Mailingliste</a> ein. Das Mailvolumen ist beschr&auml;nkt
+auf eine Mail pro Beta oder stabiler Version, was bislang nicht mehr als ein
+halbes Dutzend Mails im Jahr ausmachte.
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="devel">Entwickler-Version</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Interessiert an der allerneusten Entwicklerversion von Enigma? Diese kann
+  aus dem Quellcode-Repository heruntergeladen werden:
+  <pre>svn://svn.berlios.de/enigma-game</pre>
+  Bitte lesen Sie die <a href="$$development$$">Entwickler-Seite</a> f&uuml;r
+  detaillierte Instruktionen.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$download$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="oldversions">Alte Versionen</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Aufgrund von &Auml;nderungen im Repository und den Downloadservern
+  befinden sich die &auml;lteren Enigma-Versionen auf verschiedenen
+  Servern. Besuchen Sie daf&uuml;r
+  <ul>
+  <li><a href="http://developer.berlios.de/project/showfiles.php?group_id=3972">
+    Berlios</a>&emsp;f&uuml;r aktuellere Versionen,</li>
+  <li><a href="http://savannah.nongnu.org/download/enigma/">
+    http://savannah.nongnu.org/download/enigma/</a>&emsp;f&uuml;r vorherige Versionen,</li>
+  <li><a href="http://www.mag-heut.net/blackball/index.php?act=ST&f=2&t=118&s=1b5eee7f424b7bd5f9ef75e927a549e9">
+    mag-heut.net</a>&emsp;f&uuml;r alte Windows-Versionen.</li>
+  </ul>
+

From andreasl at mail.berlios.de  Sat Feb 24 19:12:26 2007
From: andreasl at mail.berlios.de (andreasl at BerliOS)
Date: Sat, 24 Feb 2007 19:12:26 +0100
Subject: [Enigma-game-svn] r613 - branches/1.0/src
Message-ID: <200702241812.l1OICQha023986@sheep.berlios.de>

Author: andreasl
Date: 2007-02-24 19:12:25 +0100 (Sat, 24 Feb 2007)
New Revision: 613

Modified:
   branches/1.0/src/stones_complex.cc
Log:
Fixing rev.611, st-turnstile:
 - 135 degree warp for red turnstiles,
 - 45 degree warp for green ones.


Modified: branches/1.0/src/stones_complex.cc
===================================================================
--- branches/1.0/src/stones_complex.cc	2007-02-24 01:10:09 UTC (rev 612)
+++ branches/1.0/src/stones_complex.cc	2007-02-24 18:12:25 UTC (rev 613)
@@ -2747,13 +2747,25 @@
         if (idx_source == -1) 
             continue;       // actor inside pivot -- should not happen
 
-        const int rot_index[2][8] = { // same for both versions, see rev.611
-            { 6,  6, 0,  0, 2,  2, 4,  4 }, // anticlockwise
-            { 2,  4, 4,  6, 6,  0, 0,  2 }  // clockwise
+        const int rot_index[4][8] = {
+            // The warp-destinations for actors. Why different destinations
+            // for oxyd/non-oxyd-type turnstiles? Imagine the actor on position
+            // 1 (North of pivot), the turnstile rotates anticlockwise. Then
+            // a green turnstile-arm, if at all, would push the actor one field
+            // to the left (position 0). Now assume it's a red turnstile. If the
+            // actor is to be warped, it has to be the one that activated the
+            // turnstile. Yet it is on position 1, in principle not able to
+            // hit an arm. But it can, if it hits fast enough on the edge of
+            // pivot and left arm. In this case, the actor should be handled
+            // as if on position 1, thus warping to 6.
+            { 6,  0, 0,  2, 2,  4, 4,  6 }, // anticlockwise
+            { 2,  2, 4,  4, 6,  6, 0,  0 }, // clockwise
+            { 6,  6, 0,  0, 2,  2, 4,  4 }, // anticlockwise (oxyd-compatible)
+            { 2,  4, 4,  6, 6,  0, 0,  2 }, // clockwise (oxyd-compatible)
         };
 
         bool compatible = oxyd_compatible();
-        int  idx_target = rot_index[clockwise][idx_source]; // destination index
+        int  idx_target = rot_index[clockwise+2*compatible][idx_source]; // destination index
         bool do_warp = arm_seen[idx_source]; // move the actor along with the turnstile?
 
         if (compatible) {

-        {1,0,0,1,0,1,0}},11,7,"blue","yes")
-
     ]]></el:luamain>
     <el:i18n>
       <el:string el:key="title">

 actor would be transported, then the second turnstile will be hit,

+When an actor is to be warped outside of the level by a turnstile
+(which only happens with a green one directly at the levelborder), the
+actor is shattered instead of warped. This is the only case in which a
+green turnstile is able to shatter a marble.

Modified: branches/1.0/src/world.cc
===================================================================
--- branches/1.0/src/world.cc	2007-02-24 19:50:03 UTC (rev 615)
+++ branches/1.0/src/world.cc	2007-02-24 20:53:04 UTC (rev 616)
@@ -1770,6 +1770,19 @@
     level->delayed_impulses.push_back(DelayedImpulse(impulse, delay, estimated_receiver));
 }
 
+void world::revokeDelayedImpulses(const Stone *target)
+{
+    // Revokes delayed impulses to and from target
+    ImpulseList::iterator i = level->delayed_impulses.begin(),
+        end = level->delayed_impulses.end();
+    while (i != end) {
+        if (i->is_receiver(target) || i->is_sender(target))
+            i = level->delayed_impulses.erase(i);
+        else
+            ++i;
+    }
+}
+
 void world::Tick(double dtime) {
     level->tick (dtime);
 }

Added: homepage/input/support.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/input/support.html	2007-02-24 20:53:04 UTC (rev 616)
+++ homepage/input/support.html	2007-02-25 12:13:49 UTC (rev 617)
@@ -0,0 +1 @@
+<h2>User Support</h2>

<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot
features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
for the level of the month.</p>

<ul>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others pla!
 yed Enigma.</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
</ul>
  
  <p>Have fun!</p>
  
<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="stable">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
  version of the document.</p>

  <ul>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$!
 $imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="1!
 5" alt="
German" title="German">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="French" title="French">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma_fr.html">Manuel Fran&ccedil;ais (html)</a>&emsp;
      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
  </ul>
  
  <p>Furtheron we provide a reference manual which is included in the Enigma
  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
  power users and developers.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
  </ul>
  <p>No other translations of the !
 Enigma manuals are available so far.
  Please send an email to <a
  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>

<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
  
  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
  to discuss your solution of a level with other or you may search for some tiny
  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
  
  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
  
  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
  wal!
 kthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decen!
 t hints.
 The
  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
  
<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>

  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
  
  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the !
 bottom
  line you can rate a level with values form 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
  level of the month selection.</p>

  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
  is not in use by someone else.</p>

  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
  the name you have choosen!).</p>

  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
  after every goo!
 d score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
  s!
 ufficien
t.</p> 

  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
  within a few days.</p>

  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
  you may manually download the ratings update file
  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>

<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>

  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
  with more than 200 000 lines of code and complex gam!
 ing logic like Enigma is
  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
  thounds of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
  
  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
  (You do not need to subscribe to the list).
  Please include the following basic information:
    <ul>
    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
    </ul>
  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
  
  <p>Problems wit!
 h single levels should be reported to the user forum 
  <a hre!
 f="http:
//www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
  or annoyancies with levels will remain a ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
  
  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
  
<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>

  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>
\ No newline at end of file

-<h2>User Support</h2>

<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot
features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
for the level of the month.</p>

<ul>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others pla!
 yed Enigma.</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
</ul>
  
  <p>Have fun!</p>
  
<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="stable">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
  version of the document.</p>

  <ul>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$!
 $imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="1!
 5" alt="
German" title="German">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="French" title="French">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma_fr.html">Manuel Fran&ccedil;ais (html)</a>&emsp;
      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
  </ul>
  
  <p>Furtheron we provide a reference manual which is included in the Enigma
  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
  power users and developers.</p>
  <ul>
    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
  </ul>
  <p>No other translations of the !
 Enigma manuals are available so far.
  Please send an email to <a
  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>

<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
  
  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
  to discuss your solution of a level with other or you may search for some tiny
  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
  
  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
  
  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
  wal!
 kthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decen!
 t hints.
 The
  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
  
<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>

  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
  
  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the !
 bottom
  line you can rate a level with values form 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
  level of the month selection.</p>

  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
  is not in use by someone else.</p>

  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
  the name you have choosen!).</p>

  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
  after every goo!
 d score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
  s!
 ufficien
t.</p> 

  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
  within a few days.</p>

  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
  you may manually download the ratings update file
  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>

<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>

  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
  with more than 200 000 lines of code and complex gam!
 ing logic like Enigma is
  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
  thounds of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
  
  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
  (You do not need to subscribe to the list).
  Please include the following basic information:
    <ul>
    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
    </ul>
  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
  
  <p>Problems wit!
 h single levels should be reported to the user forum 
  <a hre!
 f="http:
//www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
  or annoyancies with levels will remain a ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
  
  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
  
<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>

  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>
\ No newline at end of file
+<h2>User Support</h2>
+
+<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
+wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot
+features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
+discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
+participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
+Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
+for the level of the month.</p>
+
+<ul>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others played Enigma.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
+</ul>
+  
+  <p>Have fun!</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="stable">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
+  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
+  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
+  version of the document.</p>
+
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="French" title="French">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_fr.html">Manuel Fran&ccedil;ais (html)</a>&emsp;
+      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
+  </ul>
+  
+  <p>Furtheron we provide a reference manual which is included in the Enigma
+  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
+  power users and developers.</p>
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
+  </ul>
+  <p>No other translations of the Enigma manuals are available so far.
+  Please send an email to <a
+  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
+  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
+  
+  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
+  to discuss your solution of a level with other or you may search for some tiny
+  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
+  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
+  
+  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
+  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
+  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
+  
+  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
+  walkthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decent hints. The
+  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
+  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
+  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
+  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
+  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
+  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
+  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
+  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
+  
+  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
+  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the bottom
+  line you can rate a level with values form 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
+  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
+  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
+  level of the month selection.</p>
+
+  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
+  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
+  is not in use by someone else.</p>
+
+  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
+  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
+  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
+  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
+  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
+  the name you have choosen!).</p>
+
+  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
+  after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
+  sufficient.</p> 
+
+  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
+  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
+  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
+  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
+  within a few days.</p>
+
+  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
+  you may manually download the ratings update file
+  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
+  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
+  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
+  with more than 200 000 lines of code and complex gaming logic like Enigma is
+  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
+  thounds of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
+  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
+  
+  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
+  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
+  (You do not need to subscribe to the list).
+  Please include the following basic information:
+    <ul>
+    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
+    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
+    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
+    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
+    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
+    </ul>
+  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
+  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
+  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
+  
+  <p>Problems with single levels should be reported to the user forum 
+  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
+  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
+  or annoyancies with levels will remain a ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
+  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
+  
+  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
+  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
+  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
+  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
+  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
+  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>

Log:
Additions to the homepage, based on rev.617 (part I):
 - translation of support.html to German
 - corrections to support.html:
    - unix line ending instead of win
    - changed anchor-name of first part from "stable" to "documentation"
    - some typos
 - added imagedir_de and imagedir_fr to suppress main.lua-warnings
 - moved language_list from main.lua to output-files.lua

+<h2>User Support</h2>
+
+<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
+wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot
+features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
+discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
+participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
+Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
+for the level of the month.</p>
+
+<ul>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others played Enigma.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
+</ul>
+  
+  <p>Have fun!</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="documentation">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
+  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
+  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
+  version of the document.</p>
+
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>

+      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>

+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>

+      finished after 1.00 release!</li>

+  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
+  power users and developers.</p>

+      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>

+  Please send an email to <a

+  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
+  
+  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
+  to discuss your solution of a level with others or you may search for some tiny
+  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
+  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
