+  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
+  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
+  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
+  
+  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
+  walkthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decent hints. The
+  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
+  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
+  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
+  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
+  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
+  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
+  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
+  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
+  
+  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
+  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the bottom
+  line you can rate a level with values from 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
+  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
+  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
+  &apos;Level of the Month&apos; selection.</p>
+
+  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
+  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
+  is not in use by someone else.</p>
+
+  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
+  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
+  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
+  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
+  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
+  the name you have chosen!).</p>
+
+  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
+  after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
+  sufficient.</p> 
+
+  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
+  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
+  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
+  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
+  within a few days.</p>
+
+  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
+  you may manually download the ratings update file
+  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
+  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
+  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
+  with more than 200 000 lines of code and complex gaming logic like Enigma is
+  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
+  thousands of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
+  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
+  
+  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
+  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
+  (you do not need to subscribe to the list).
+  Please include the following basic information:
+    <ul>
+    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
+    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
+    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
+    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
+    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
+    </ul>
+  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
+  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
+  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
+  
+  <p>Problems with single levels should be reported to the user forum 
+  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
+  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
+  or annoyances with levels will remain an ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
+  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
+  
+  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
+  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
+  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
+  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
+  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
+  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>

Added: homepage/input/support_de.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/input/support_de.html	2007-02-25 13:27:00 UTC (rev 618)
+++ homepage/input/support_de.html	2007-02-25 18:44:02 UTC (rev 619)
@@ -0,0 +1,189 @@
+<h2>Spieler-Support</h2>
+
+<p>Sie haben Enigma schon und suchen jetzt nach weiteren Informationen?
+F&uuml;r aufkommende Fragen haben wir Handb&uuml;cher geschrieben und eine
+FAQ zusammengestellt. Die Dokumentation sollte viele der Features
+erkl&auml;ren, nach denen Sie vielleicht suchen. Falls Sie in einem Level
+festh&auml;ngen oder einfach nur &uuml;ber Enigma diskutieren m&ouml;chten,
+sollten Sie einen Blick auf das Forum werfen. Sie k&ouml;nnen aktiv an Enigma
+teilhaben, wenn Sie Ihre Spielergebnisse &uuml;bermitteln und Levels
+bewerten. Ihre Ergebnisse flie&szlig;en in die Auswertung der Statistiken ein,
+und Ihre Bewertungen bestimmen den Level des Monats mit.</p>
+
+<ul>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Dokumentation</a> - Die aktuellsten
+  Versionen - beginnen Sie hier.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - H&auml;ufig gestellte Fragen (und ihre Antworten).</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Diskutieren Sie Enigma mit
+  anderen Spielern.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Ergebnisse mitteilen</a> - Schicken Sie uns
+  ihre Spielergebnisse und Wertungen.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Spielstatistiken</a> - Sehen Sie wie Sie und
+  andere Enigma spielen.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Fehlerberichte</a> - Wie Sie uns Fehler melden
+  k&ouml;nnen.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Spenden</a> - Wie Sie Enigmas
+  Weiterentwicklung unterst&uuml;tzen k&ouml;nnen.</li>
+</ul>
+  
+  <p>Viel Spa&szlig;!</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="documentation">Dokumentation f&uuml;r Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
+  <p>Das vollst&auml;ndige Benutzerhandbuch ist in mehreren Sprachen jeder
+  Version von Enigma beigef&uuml;gt. Sie k&ouml;nnen es zus&auml;tzlich auf
+  dieser Seite betrachten oder als PDF herunterladen.</p>
+
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Englisch" title="Englisch">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Englisch" title="Englisch">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Deutsch" title="Deutsch">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Deutsch" title="Deutsch">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Franz&ouml;sisch" title="Franz&ouml;sisch">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_fr.html">Manuel Fran&ccedil;ais (html)</a>&emsp;
+      komplettiert nach der 1.00-Version!</li>
+  </ul>
+    
+  <p>Desweiteren stellen wir ein Referenzhandbuch zur Verf&uuml;gung, das
+  ebenfalls im Enigma-Paket enthalten ist. Viele Details in der Referenz
+  werden nicht nur f&uuml;r Poweruser und Entwickler hilfreich sein.</p>
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="Englisch" title="Englisch">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">Englisches Referenzhandbuch (html)</a></li>
+  </ul>
+  <p>Aktuell gibt es keine weiteren &Uuml;bersetzungen der
+  Enigma-Handb&uuml;cher. Bitte senden Sie uns eine Email an <a
+  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>, falls
+  Sie eine &Uuml;bersetzung beisteuern wollen.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="forum">Forum</a></h3>
+  
+  <p>Ein Spiel wie Enigma h&auml;lt einen dazu an, sich mit anderen Spielern
+  auszutauschen. Sie wollen vielleicht die L&ouml;sung eines Levels bereden
+  oder ein paar kleine Hinweise f&uuml;r andere suchen. Im Forum <a
+  href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a> k&ouml;nnen Sie Ihre
+  Erfahrungen mit Hunderten anderer Spieler teilen.</p>
+  
+  <p>Nur eine Bitte im Sinne aller Forumsnutzer: Bitte suchen Sie
+  zun&auml;chst nach Diskussionsf&auml;den &uuml;ber dasselbe Thema,
+  z.B. denselben Level. H&auml;ngen Sie Ihre Bemerkung oder Frage via
+  &quot;reply&quot; an, statt einen neuen Diskussionsfaden zu beginnen.</p>
+  
+  <p>Und noch eine Bitte im Sinne unserer Levelautoren: Verderben Sie nicht
+  den Spa&szlig; an einer Level, indem Sie Komplettl&ouml;sungen
+  ver&ouml;ffentlichen. Selbst andere Spieler bevorzugen normalerweise
+  dezentere Hinweise. Das Forum bietet daf&uuml;r die M&ouml;glichkeit,
+  Hinweise mit derselben Vorder- wie Hintergrundfarbe zu schreiben (Farbe
+  &quot;spoiler&quot;). Leser k&ouml;nnen dann den Hinweis markieren und so
+  nach eigenem Ermessen den Hinweis lesen oder auch nicht. Halten Sie also
+  bitte die Spannung an Enigmas R&auml;tseln f&uuml;r alle Spieler
+  aufrecht.</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="score">Ergebnisse und Wertungen mitteilen</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Seit Enigma 1.00 k&ouml;nnen Sie Ihre Spielergebnisse und Wertungen der
+  Levels bei uns registrieren lassen. Warum ist das sinnvoll? Auf Basis dieser
+  Daten berechnen wir die Statistiken, die Sie im Levelinspektor &uuml;ber
+  einen Level finden. Schlie&szlig;lich kann sogar das Wissen, dass viele
+  Nutzer eine bestimmte Level nicht gel&ouml;st haben, ebenso wie die besten
+  Ergebnisse zur Verbesserung von Enigma beitragen.</p>
+  
+  <p>Bitte nutzen Sie die M&ouml;glichkeit, Levels zu bewerten. Rechts- oder
+  CTRL-klicken Sie daf&uuml;r auf einen Level im Levelmen&uuml;, um so den
+  Levelinspektor aufzurufen. Hier k&ouml;nnen Sie in der untersten Zeile den
+  Level mit Werten zwischen 0 (schlecht) und 10 (perfekt) bewerten. Versuchen
+  Sie dabei, sowohl gute wie schlechte Levels zu beurteilen. Durchschnittliche
+  Level sollten mit 5 bewertet werden. Ihre Wertung misst die Popularit&auml;t
+  eines Levels und stellt die Grundlage dar f&uuml;r die monatliche Wahl zum
+  &quot;Level des Monats&quot;.</p>
+
+  <p>Es ist n&ouml;tig, dass Sie f&uuml;r sich einen einzigartigen
+  Spielernamen im Optionsmen&uuml; angeben. Bitte werfen Sie einen Blick auf
+  unsere <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">Spielerliste</a>, um
+  sicherzustellen, dass Ihr favorisierter Name nicht schon vergeben ist.</p>
+
+  <p>Um dann Ihre Ergebnisse registrieren zu lassen, mailen Sie uns einfach
+  die Datei &quot;enigma.score&quot;. Sie befindet sich in Ihrem
+  &quot;Userpfad&quot;, der Ihnen von Enigma angezeigt wird, wenn Sie im
+  Hauptmen&uuml; F2 dr&uuml;cken. Bitte senden Sie uns diese einzelne Datei an  
+  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
+  mit dem Betreff &quot;score - Spielername&quot; (ersetzen Sie dabei
+  &quot;Spielername&quot; gegen den von Ihnen gew&auml;hlten Namen!).</p>
+
+  <p>Die Ergebnisse werden monatlich ausgewertet. Bitte schicken Sie sie uns
+  nicht nach jedem guten Spiel; einmal zum Ende des Monats ist v&ouml;llig
+  ausreichend.</p> 
+
+  <p>Die erneuerten Statistiken werden automatisch auf Ihren Computer
+  &uuml;berspielt, wenn Sie die &quot;Update Bewertungen&quot;-Option auf
+  &quot;Autom.&quot; gestellt haben. Enigma wird dann ein paar Mal im Monat
+  auf dem Server nach neuen Statistiken suchen, unabh&auml;ngig davon, wie oft
+  Sie die Anwendung starten. Die Netzlast ist ziemlich gering, da jeweils nur
+  Erg&auml;nzungen heruntergeladen werden, Sie erhalten so alle Updates
+  innerhalb weniger Tage.</p>
+
+  <p>Falls Sie die meiste Zeit offline spielen und die &quot;Update
+  Bewertungen&quot;-Option auf &quot;Nie&quot; gestellt haben, k&ouml;nnen Sie
+  die aktuellen Statistiken auch manuell herunterladen:
+  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
+  Entpacken Sie diese ZIP-Datei und kopieren Sie den Inhalt in Ihren
+  &quot;Userpfad&quot;, in der sich schon Ihre &quot;enigma.score&quot;-Datei
+  befindet.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="bug">Fehlerberichte</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Wir sind dankbar &uuml;ber alle Problemberichte, die Enigma
+  betreffen. Nat&uuml;rlich ist eine Software mit mehr als 200.000 Zeilen
+  Quelltext und komplexer Spiellogik wie Enigma niemals fehlerfrei. Aber
+  Enigma hat eine erstaunlich stabile Version 1.00 hervorgebracht, mit vielen
+  Tausend Nutzern. Bitte konsultieren Sie im Fall eines Problems zun&auml;chst
+  die Dokumentation, FAQ und das Forum f&uuml;r m&ouml;glicherweise
+  &auml;hnliche Fehlerberichte.</p>
+  
+  <p>F&uuml;r andere Probleme als die L&ouml;sbarkeit von Levels senden Sie
+  uns bitte eine Email an die Entwickler-Mailingliste <a
+  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
+  (Sie m&uuml;ssen daf&uuml;r nicht auf dieser Liste angemeldet sein). Ihre
+  Email sollte folgende grundlegende Informationen enthalten:
+    <ul>
+    <li>Welches Betriebssystem verwenden Sie?</li>
+    <li>Welche Version von Enigma verwenden Sie?</li>
+    <li>Was haben Sie gemacht, als der Fehler auftrat?</li>
+    <li>Was genau haben Sie dann gesehen?</li>
+    <li>Besteht das Problem weiterhin oder ist es wiederholbar?</li>
+    </ul>
+  Wenn Sie uns Ihren Fehlerbericht geschickt haben, bleiben Sie bitte am Ball
+  und beantworten weitere Nachfragen der Entwickler nach spezifischen
+  Details. Bitte erwarten Sie auch keine umgehenden Antworten - es kann
+  durchaus einige Zeit dauern, bis die richtigen Leute Ihre Frage
+  beantworten.</p>
+  
+  <p>Probleme, die sich auf einzelne Levels beziehen, sollten Sie im Forum   
+  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a> posten. Bitte denken Sie
+  daran, dass alle Levels in Enigma 1.00 l&ouml;sbar sind. Dennoch k&ouml;nnen
+  unbeabsichtigte Abk&uuml;rzungen oder &Auml;rgernisse in einem Level zu
+  einem Dauerthema werden und manchmal stellt sich sogar heraus, dass
+  Sie von einer Inkonsistenz in Enigma selbst verursacht werden.</p>
+  
+  <p>Entwickler k&ouml;nnen Fehlerberichte auch direkt in unserer
+  Fehlerdatenbank auf <a
+  href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios</a>
+  eintragen.
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="donation">Spenden</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Wir fragen uns schon, wieviele Spieler willens sind, die weitere
+  Entwicklung des Projekts finanziell zu unterst&uuml;tzen. Nur einen
+  Bruchteil davon zu spenden, was Sie sonst f&uuml;r ein kommerzielles
+  &quot;Enigma&quot; in einem Gesch&auml;ft bezahlt h&auml;tten, k&ouml;nnte
+  uns bei weiteren Verbesserungen helfen. Falls Sie denken, das sei ein fairer
+  Handel, mailen Sie uns bitte an .... und wir werden ein Spendenkonto
+  f&uuml;r Enigma einrichten.</p>

 <h2>Development</h2>
 
-<h3>Becoming involved</h3>
-
-<p>Enigma is developed by a small group of volunteers.  We all work on it in
+<p>Do you like to become involved? Enigma is developed by a small group of volunteers.  We all work on it in
 our spare time, which is naturally scarce.  If you would like to help out,
-you're always welcome.  If you are interested in contributing to Enigma, please
-<a
-href="http://mail.nongnu.org/mailman/listinfo/enigma-devel">subscribe to 
-Enigma's development mailing list</a>.</p>
+you're always welcome.</p>
 
-<h3>Getting the development version </h3>
+<ul>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#maillist">Development Maillist</a> - Becoming involved.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#tasks">Open Tasks and Whishes</a> - Suggested areas of improvement.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#level">Level Development</a> - Resources and Hints.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#app">Application Development</a> - Download and Compilation.</li>
+</ul>
 
-<p><a href="https://developer.berlios.de/svn/?group_id=3972">Enigma's
-Subversion repository</a> is now hosted on Berlios.  For anonymous
-access, simply run
-<pre>
-svn checkout svn://svn.berlios.de/enigma-game/trunk
-</pre>
-Please contact us if you need write access to the repository.
-</p>
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="maillist">Development Maillist</a></h3>
 
+  If you are interested in contributing to Enigma, please
+  <a href="http://mail.nongnu.org/mailman/listinfo/enigma-devel">subscribe to 
+  Enigma's development mailing list</a>. Listen and ask your questions. Answer
+  questions of others, publish own contributions like levels or patches, or offer
+  your help.</p>
+  
+  <p>Please note that due to the international group of developers all mailings
+  to the list have to be written in English. If you need to attach files to your
+  mail check that the size does not exceed the mailing list limit of 300 kBytes.
+  Mails that are larger than the limit will just be discarded!</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="tasks">Open Tasks and Whishes</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Here is a list of open tasks, most of which we currently don't have 
+  the resources to tackle ourselves.  We <i>definitely need</i> your help
+  with these.  If you have the necessary skills and some spare time,
+  please consider helping us out. </p>
+
+  <ul>
+  <li><b>Translation</b>.  Enigma has proper support for languages other than
+      English.  If you would like to help us localize Enigma to your native
+      language, please contact us.  This concerns not only the buttons and
+      levels in Enigma, but also the manuals, the FAQ, the Wiki and this
+      homepage.  (Translation into different dialects are interesting,
+      too!) <i>Easy</i></li>
+      
+  <li><b>Better graphics</b>.  We're currently lacking in the arts
+      department, as you may have noticed.  If you have more talent than we
+      have, we'd be only too glad to replace our sprites, logos, and other
+      images with better ones. <i>Easy-Medium</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Network game</b>.  This is a big and non-trivial undertaking.
+      If you like challenges and have some experience in network
+      programming, feel free to join us. <i>Difficult</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Level editor</b>.  This has been requested by many
+      users, and would in fact be a great addition.  It's a good deal
+      of work, but reasonably easy.  Use of Java seems sensible, however, you
+      could as well work with the existing editors and update
+      them.  (Well, Mac-users would like to have an editor,
+      too.) <i>Medium</i></li>
+      
+  <li><b>Levels</b>.  We're constantly searching (good) levels.  Although
+      there currently is no editor for 1.00 available, programming levels
+      isn't too difficult, given the existing tools. <i>Easy-Medium</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Sounds</b>.  Sounds are currently incomplete, and some of the
+      existing ones might (do!) need some polish. <i>Medium</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Ports</b>.  Although Enigma already covers most important platforms,
+      there are still many open points: More packs for the different
+      Linux-distributions, tests to compile Enigma with Visual Studio, another
+      active programmer to help us fix bugs that occur on Macs, exotic targets
+      like game consoles or handhelds. <i>Easy-Difficult</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Maintaining the homepage</b>.  Someone has to add news and monthly
+      updates (like ratings user statistics) to the homepage.  This is not
+      much work, dependent on what is planned for the homepage.  But
+      nevertheless we need someone who does this regularly for
+      us. <i>Easy</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Tech-support</b>.  The larger Enigmas code gets, the more technical
+      questions and problems arise on mag-heut.net and devel-ml.  This
+      sometimes involves the monthly repetition of the ever same answers,
+      sometimes really nasty bug-chases, and sometimes just the redirection of
+      the question to the right people. We'd be glad if someone who's also
+      able to dive into foreign code could help us with this
+      task. <i>Easy-Medium</i></li>
+
+  </ul>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="level">Level Development</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Even though Enigma does not include a level editor and you may have to dig
+  into the simple script language Lua developing a level is easier than you may
+  assume.</p>
+  
+  <p>The Enigma <a href="$$refman$$">reference manual</a> explains the level 
+  format and all objects you can use in detail. You should at least cross read 
+  chapters 1 - 3 and remember that you can look up details about every object.<p>
+  
+  <p>For your first experiments and as a practical guide to level coding you 
+  should have a look at the <a href="$$wiki$$">level development wiki</a>. It 
+  focuses on the most common object features and gives you valuable code 
+  snippets for many common tasks.</p>
+  
+  <p>You will find help on the <a href="$$development$$#maillist">developer 
+  mailing list</a> as well as in the <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">forum</a>.
+  As soon as you think that your level is finished, set the level XML
+  attribut &apos;status&apos; to &apos;stable&apos; and publish the level to
+  the mailing list and/or to the forum. People will test and comment your level.
+  When no shortcuts are found and you finish the development of a level you
+  should set the status to &apos;released&apos; and republish this version.
+  We collect the levels from these sources and will contact you on remaining
+  issues.</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="app">Application Development</a></h3>
+
+  <p>If you want to download the leading edge version of Enigma you need to
+  check it out from our <a href="https://developer.berlios.de/svn/?group_id=3972">
+  subversion source code repository at Berlios</a>. For anonymous access, simply 
+  run
+  <pre>svn checkout svn://svn.berlios.de/enigma-game/trunk</pre>
+  to download the current revision of the next major Enigma release. Please note
+  that this will be a snapshot of development and the revision might be incomplete
+  and still unstable.</p>
+  
+  <p>The repository provides several branches of the project.
+  <table class="repository">
+  <tr><td class="path">/trunk</td><td>next major release (1.1 branch)</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/branches/1.0</td><td>next minor release (1.01)</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/branches/eval</td><td>current stable release (1.00) with score evaluation software</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/tags/0.92</td><td>stable 0.92 release</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/tags/1.00</td><td>stable 1.00 release</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/homepage</td><td>guess what</td></tr>
+  </table>
+  
+  You can get an up to date preview of the existing branches with
+  <a href="http://svn.berlios.de/wsvn/enigma-game">Berlios WebSVN</a>
+  </p>
+  
+  <p>For the development we recommend a Unix platform as the compilation
+  and installation is as simple as typing
+  
+  <pre>./autogen.sh && ./configure && make && make install</pre>
+
+  <p>For information how to compile the application for Windows read the file
+  
+  <pre>doc/README.mingw32</pre>
+  </p>
+  
+  <p>Please contact us via the <a href="$$development$$#maillist">mailing list</a>
+  if you need write access to therepository.</p>
+

-for the level of the month.</p>

-  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
-  power users and developers.</p>

-      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
-  </ul>
-  <p>No other translations of the Enigma manuals are available so far.
-  Please send an email to <a
-  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
-  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
-  
-  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
-  to discuss your solution of a level with others or you may search for some tiny
-  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
-  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
-  
-  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
-  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
-  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
-  
-  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
-  walkthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decent hints. The
-  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
-  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
-  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
-  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
-  
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>
-
-  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
-  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
-  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
-  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
-  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
-  
-  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
-  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the bottom
-  line you can rate a level with values from 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
-  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
-  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
-  &apos;Level of the Month&apos; selection.</p>
-
-  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
-  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
-  is not in use by someone else.</p>
-
-  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
-  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
-  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
-  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
-  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
-  the name you have chosen!).</p>
-
-  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
-  after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
-  sufficient.</p> 
-
-  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
-  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
-  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
-  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
-  within a few days.</p>
-
-  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
-  you may manually download the ratings update file
-  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
-  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
-  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>
-
-  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
-  with more than 200 000 lines of code and complex gaming logic like Enigma is
-  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
-  thousands of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
-  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
-  
-  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
-  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
-  (you do not need to subscribe to the list).
-  Please include the following basic information:
-    <ul>
-    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
-    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
-    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
-    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
-    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
-    </ul>
-  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
-  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
-  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
-  
-  <p>Problems with single levels should be reported to the user forum 
-  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
-  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
-  or annoyances with levels will remain an ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
-  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
-  
-  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
-  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
-  
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>
-
-  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
-  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
-  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
-  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
-  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>
+<h2>User Support</h2>
+
+<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
+wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot
+features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
+discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
+participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
+Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
+for the level of the month.</p>
+
+<ul>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others played Enigma.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
+</ul>
+  
+  <p>Have fun!</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="documentation">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
+  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
+  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
+  version of the document.</p>
+
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="French" title="French">&emsp;

+      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
+  </ul>
+  
+  <p>Furtheron we provide a reference manual which is included in the Enigma
+  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
+  power users and developers.</p>
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
+  </ul>
+  <p>No other translations of the Enigma manuals are available so far.
+  Please send an email to <a
+  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
+  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
+  
+  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
+  to discuss your solution of a level with others or you may search for some tiny
+  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
+  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
+  
+  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
+  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
+  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
+  
+  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
+  walkthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decent hints. The
+  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
+  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
+  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
+  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
+  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
+  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
+  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
+  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
+  
+  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
+  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the bottom
+  line you can rate a level with values from 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
+  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
+  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
+  &apos;Level of the Month&apos; selection.</p>
+
+  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
+  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
+  is not in use by someone else.</p>
+
+  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
+  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
+  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
+  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
+  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
+  the name you have chosen!).</p>
+
+  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
+  after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
+  sufficient.</p> 
+
+  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
+  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
+  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
+  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
+  within a few days.</p>
+
+  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
+  you may manually download the ratings update file
+  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
+  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
+  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
+  with more than 200&nbsp;000 lines of code and complex gaming logic like Enigma is
+  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
+  thousands of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
+  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
+  
+  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
+  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
+  (you do not need to subscribe to the list).
+  Please include the following basic information:
+    <ul>
+    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
+    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
+    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
+    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
+    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
+    </ul>
+  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
+  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
+  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
+  
+  <p>Problems with single levels should be reported to the user forum 
+  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
+  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
+  or annoyances with levels will remain an ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
+  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
+  
+  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
+  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
+  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
+  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
+  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
+  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>

Property changes on: homepage/input/stat-head_de.html

Name: svn:eol-style
   + native

Modified: homepage/input/stat-help.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/input/stat-help.html	2007-02-25 19:20:29 UTC (rev 620)
+++ homepage/input/stat-help.html	2007-02-25 19:44:33 UTC (rev 621)
@@ -1,29 +1,29 @@
-  <div class="stat-help">
-    <h3>Explanations</h3>
-    <h4>total</h4>
-      All distributed levels are counted for a total. If a level provides an
-      easy mode both versions are taken into account. Levels that appear
-      several times in different levelpacks are just counted once.
-    <h4>shared</h4>
-      Scores are measured by a resolution of 1 second. If two or more users
-      finish a level within the same second they will both have the same score
-      and they share the worldrecord. The wordrecord is taken into account for
-      the total worldrecord count for both competitors.
-    <h4>handicap</h4>
-      For players who are not keen on worldrecords but still have ambitions to
-      find straight and fast solutions for levels we introduced another measure.
-      We call it handicap as it is similar to the golfers handicap. In general
-      a lower value is better than a higher one. The range is limited from 
-      +100 to -300. A player who solves the levels in average time will gain
-      a handicap of 0.0. The handicap sums up by the derivation of the players
-      score from the professional average score (PAR) that is given for each
-      level. In order to make handicap values comparable they are always
-      normalized to 100 levels - the standard size of a levelpack.
-    <h4>solved hcp</h4>
-      The solved handicap is the handicap that is calculated over all levels 
-      that a player solved. Additionally 10% of the unsolved levels are taken
-      into account for unsuccessful solvage attempts. This way the solved hcp
-      can be used to compare players with quite different solvalge rates. It
-      shows if a player solves levels fast or slow.
-  </div>
-
+  <div class="stat-help">
+    <h3>Explanations</h3>
+    <h4>total</h4>
+      All distributed levels are counted for a total. If a level provides an
+      easy mode both versions are taken into account. Levels that appear
+      several times in different levelpacks are just counted once.
+    <h4>shared</h4>
+      Scores are measured by a resolution of 1 second. If two or more users
+      finish a level within the same second they will both have the same score
+      and they share the worldrecord. The wordrecord is taken into account for
+      the total worldrecord count for both competitors.
+    <h4>handicap</h4>
+      For players who are not keen on worldrecords but still have ambitions to
+      find straight and fast solutions for levels we introduced another measure.
+      We call it handicap as it is similar to the golfers handicap. In general
+      a lower value is better than a higher one. The range is limited from 
+      +100 to -300. A player who solves the levels in average time will gain
+      a handicap of 0.0. The handicap sums up by the derivation of the players
+      score from the professional average score (PAR) that is given for each
+      level. In order to make handicap values comparable they are always
+      normalized to 100 levels - the standard size of a levelpack.
+    <h4>solved hcp</h4>
+      The solved handicap is the handicap that is calculated over all levels 
+      that a player solved. Additionally 10% of the unsolved levels are taken
+      into account for unsuccessful solvage attempts. This way the solved hcp
+      can be used to compare players with quite different solvalge rates. It
+      shows if a player solves levels fast or slow.
+  </div>
+

Modified: homepage/input/support.html

--- homepage/input/support.html	2007-02-25 19:20:29 UTC (rev 620)
+++ homepage/input/support.html	2007-02-25 19:44:33 UTC (rev 621)
@@ -1,157 +1,157 @@
-<h2>User Support</h2>
-
-<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
-wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot
-features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
-discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
-participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
-Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
-for the level of the month.</p>
-
-<ul>
-  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
-  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
-  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
-  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
-  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others played Enigma.</li>
-  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
-  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
-</ul>
-  
-  <p>Have fun!</p>
-  
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="documentation">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
-  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
-  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
-  version of the document.</p>
-
-  <ul>
-    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
-    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="French" title="French">&emsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma_fr.html">Manuel Fran&ccedil;ais (html)</a>&emsp;
-      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
-  </ul>
-  
-  <p>Furtheron we provide a reference manual which is included in the Enigma
-  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
-  power users and developers.</p>
-  <ul>
-    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
-      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
-  </ul>
-  <p>No other translations of the Enigma manuals are available so far.
-  Please send an email to <a
-  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
-  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
-  
-  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
-  to discuss your solution of a level with others or you may search for some tiny
-  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
-  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
-  
-  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
-  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
-  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
-  
-  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
-  walkthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decent hints. The
-  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
-  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
-  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
-  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
-  
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>
-
-  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
-  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
-  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
-  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
-  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
-  
-  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
-  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the bottom
-  line you can rate a level with values from 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
-  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
-  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
-  &apos;Level of the Month&apos; selection.</p>
-
-  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
-  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
-  is not in use by someone else.</p>
-
-  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
-  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
-  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
-  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
-  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
-  the name you have chosen!).</p>
-
-  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
-  after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
-  sufficient.</p> 
-
-  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
-  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
-  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
-  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
-  within a few days.</p>
-
-  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
-  you may manually download the ratings update file
-  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
-  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
-  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>
-
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>
-
-  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
-  with more than 200&nbsp;000 lines of code and complex gaming logic like Enigma is
-  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
-  thousands of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
-  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
-  
-  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
-  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
-  (you do not need to subscribe to the list).
-  Please include the following basic information:
-    <ul>
-    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
-    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
-    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
-    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
-    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
-    </ul>
-  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
-  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
-  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
-  
-  <p>Problems with single levels should be reported to the user forum 
-  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
-  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
-  or annoyances with levels will remain an ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
-  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
-  
-  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
-  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
-  
-<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
-  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>
-
-  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
-  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
-  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
-  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
-  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>
+<h2>User Support</h2>
+
+<p>Got Enigma and looking for more information? For upcoming questions we
+wrote manuals and collected FAQ's. The documentation should reveal a lot
+features that you may look for. If you are stuck on a level or just want to
+discuss Enigma with others you should have a look at the forum. You can actively
+participate to Enigma as a user by submitting your scores and ratings of levels.
+Your results will be part of the statistics evaluation and will be your vote
+for the level of the month.</p>
+
+<ul>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#documentation">Documentation</a> - The most up to date release packages - start here.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$faq$$">FAQ</a> - Frequently asked questions (and their answers).</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#forum">Forum</a> - Discuss Enigma with other users.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#score">Score Registration</a> - Submit your scores and ratings.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$statistics$$">Score Statistics</a> - See how you and others played Enigma.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#bug">Bug Reporting</a> - How to report bugs.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$support$$#donation">Donation</a> - How to support the Enigma development.</li>
+</ul>
+  
+  <p>Have fun!</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="documentation">Documentation for Enigma 1.00</a></h3>
+  <p>The complete user manual is included in multiple languages with every release
+  of Enigma. You can additionally access it from this site or download a PDF
+  version of the document.</p>
+
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.html">English User manual (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma.pdf">English User manual (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.html">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (html)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/de.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="German" title="German">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_de.pdf">Deutsches Benutzerhandbuch (pdf)</a></li>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/fr.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="French" title="French">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma_fr.html">Manuel Fran&ccedil;ais (html)</a>&emsp;
+      finished after 1.00 release!</li>
+  </ul>
+  
+  <p>Furtheron we provide a reference manual which is included in the Enigma
+  package, too. Many details listed here will be helpful not only for 
+  power users and developers.</p>
+  <ul>
+    <li><img src="$$imagedir$$/flags25x15/gb.png" border="0" width="25" height="15" alt="English" title="English">&emsp;
+      <a href="manual/enigma-ref.html">English Reference manual (html)</a></li>
+  </ul>
+  <p>No other translations of the Enigma manuals are available so far.
+  Please send an email to <a
+  href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org">enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a> if
+  you would like to contribute a translation.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="forum">User Forum</a></h3>
+  
+  <p>Playing a game like Enigma causes a demand for communication. You may want
+  to discuss your solution of a level with others or you may search for some tiny
+  hints for others. On the forum <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>
+  you can share your experience with hundreds of other users.</p>
+  
+  <p>Just a request on behalf of all forum users: please search for discussion
+  threads that have been started to the same topic, f.e. level. Append your 
+  remark or question via &apos;reply&apos; instead of starting a new thread.</p>
+  
+  <p>And another request on behalf of the level authors: do not spoil levels by publishing
+  walkthrough solutions. Even other users will usually prefer decent hints. The
+  forum offers the possiblity to write hints with the same color as the background
+  (color &quot;spoiler&quot;). Users will see the hints without being directly
+  able to read them. By selecting the text you can read the hints you have
+  need of. Keep the fascination alive for all users.</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="score">Score and Rating Registration</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 you can register your scores and ratings. Why is
+  it useful to submit your results? Based on as many user results as possible
+  we calculate statistics that you use by inspecting a levels info. Thus even
+  the fact that many users did not solve certain levels is as important as the
+  knowledge of top scores for improving Enigma.</p>
+  
+  <p>Please make use of the possibility to rate levels. Right or ctrl click on
+  the level icon in the level menu to view the level inspector. At the bottom
+  line you can rate a level with values from 0 (bad) to 10 (top). Try to judge
+  bad levels as well as good levels. Average levels should be judged by a value
+  of 5. Your judgement shows which levels users like and is the basis for the
+  &apos;Level of the Month&apos; selection.</p>
+
+  <p>You need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please look at
+  the <a href="$$statistics$$#userlist">users&nbsp;list</a> if your favorite name
+  is not in use by someone else.</p>
+
+  <p>For registration of your scores just send us your &apos;enigma.score&apos;
+  file. It is located at your &apos;user path&apos; that Enigma shows you on
+  pressing F2 at the main menu. Please send just this one file to
+  <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
+  with subject &apos;score - username&apos; (substitute &apos;username&apos; by
+  the name you have chosen!).</p>
+
+  <p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
+  after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
+  sufficient.</p> 
+
+  <p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
+  ratings update option to &apos;Auto&apos;. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
+  per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
+  is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
+  within a few days.</p>
+
+  <p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to &apos;Never&apos;
+  you may manually download the ratings update file
+  <a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
+  Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your &apos;user path&apos; aside
+  your &apos;enigma.score&apos; file.</p>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="bug">Bug Reporting</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We appreciate any report about problems with Enigma. Of course a software
+  with more than 200&nbsp;000 lines of code and complex gaming logic like Enigma is
+  never bug free. But Enigma reached a quite stable 1.00 release with many
+  thousands of users. Please first look at the documentation, faq and user
+  forum for possible similar reports.</p>
+  
+  <p>For problems besides the solvability of levels send a mail to the developers
+  mailing list <a href="mailto:enigma-devel at nongnu.org" >enigma-devel at nongnu.org</a>
+  (you do not need to subscribe to the list).
+  Please include the following basic information:
+    <ul>
+    <li>What operating system are you using?</li>
+    <li>Which Enigma version are you using?</li>
+    <li>What did you do when the bug happened?</li>
+    <li>What exactly did you see then?</li>
+    <li>Is the problem ongoing or reproducable?</li>
+    </ul>
+  If you file a report please stay tuned on and answer further requests on
+  specific details by our developers. Do not expect immediate answers - it may
+  take some time for the right people to answer your request.</p>
+  
+  <p>Problems with single levels should be reported to the user forum 
+  <a href="http://www.mag-heut.net">mag-heut.net</a>. Please keep in mind that 
+  all levels have been proven solvable with Enigma 1.00. But unintended shortcuts 
+  or annoyances with levels will remain an ongoing topic and may sometimes emerge
+  to be caused by inconsistencies within Enigma itself.</p>
+  
+  <p>Developers may want to file bug reports directly to our bug database at 
+  <a href="http://developer.berlios.de/projects/enigma-game/">Berlios.</a>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$support$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top">
+  <a name="donation">Donation</a></h3>
+
+  <p>We are just wondering if users would be willing to support the further
+  development of Enigma financially. Just donating a fraction of the amount
+  you would be willing to spend for a commercial &apos;Enigma&apos; in a store
+  would help us to improve Enigma. If you think this would be a fair deal send
+  us mail to .... and we will set up a donation account dedicated to Enigma.</p>

+  <a href="http://svn.berlios.de/wsvn/enigma-game">Berlios WebSVN</a>.</p>
   
   <p>For the development we recommend a Unix platform as the compilation
   and installation is as simple as typing

Modified: homepage/input/development_de.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/input/development_de.html	2007-02-26 21:30:20 UTC (rev 622)
+++ homepage/input/development_de.html	2007-02-26 22:19:59 UTC (rev 623)
@@ -1,23 +1,184 @@
 <h2>Entwicklung</h2>
 
-<h3>T&auml;tig werden</h3>
+<p>W&uuml;rden Sie gerne an Enigma mithelfen? Enigma wird von einer kleinen
+Gruppe Freiwilliger entwickelt. Wir arbeiten in unserer Freizeit, die
+naturgem&auml;&szlig; recht begrenzt ist. Falls Sie uns helfen m&ouml;chten,
+sind Sie jederzeit willkommen!</p>
 
-<p>Enigma wird von einer kleinen Gruppe Freiwilliger entwickelt. Wir arbeiten
-in unserer Freizeit, die naturgem&auml;&szlig; recht begrenzt ist. Falls Sie
-uns helfen m&ouml;chten, sind Sie jederzeit willkommen! Falls Sie Interesse
-haben, an diesem Projekt t&auml;tig zu werden, melden Sie sich bitte bei der
-<a href="http://mail.nongnu.org/mailman/listinfo/enigma-devel">
-Entwickler-Mailingliste</a> an und schreiben Sie uns.</p>
+<ul>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#maillist">Entwickler-Mailingliste</a> -
+  Einbezogen werden.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#tasks">Offene Aufgaben und Wunschliste</a> -
+  Vorschl&auml;ge f&uuml;r Verbesserungen.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#level">Levelprogrammierung</a> - Ressourcen und
+  Hinweise.</li>
+  <li><a href="$$development$$#app">Programmierung der Anwendung
+  &quot;Enigma&quot;</a> - Herunterladen und kompilieren.</li>
+</ul>
 
-<h3>Wie man die Entwicklerversion herunterl&auml;dt</h3>
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
+  <a name="maillist">Entwickler-Mailingliste</a></h3>
 
-<p><a href="https://developer.berlios.de/svn/?group_id=3972">Enigmas
-Subversion Repository</a> wird momentan von Berlios gehostet. F&uuml;r
-anonymen Zugriff starten Sie einfach
-<pre>
-svn checkout svn://svn.berlios.de/enigma-game/trunk
-</pre>
-Bitte kontaktieren Sie uns, wenn Sie Schreibzugriff auf das Repository
-ben&ouml;tigen.
-</p>
+  Falls Sie Interesse haben, an Enigma t&auml;tig zu werden, melden Sie sich
+  bitte bei der <a href="http://mail.nongnu.org/mailman/listinfo/enigma-devel">
+  Entwickler-Mailingliste</a> an. H&ouml;ren Sie den Fragen anderer zu,
+  stellen Sie eigene Fragen. Antworten Sie auf die Fragen anderer,
+  ver&ouml;ffentlichen Sie eigene Beitr&auml;ge wie Levels oder Patches oder
+  bieten Sie Ihre Hilfe an.</p> 
+  
+  <p>Bitte bemerken Sie dabei, dass aufgrund der Internationalit&auml;t der
+  Entwicklergruppe alle Mails auf der Liste in Englisch geschrieben werden
+  sollten. Falls Sie Dateien anh&auml;ngen, stellen Sie bitte sicher, dass
+  die Gesamtmail die 300 kByte-Grenze unserer Mailingliste nicht
+  sprengt. Gr&ouml;&szlig;ere Mails werden automatisch verworfen!</p>
 
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
+  <a name="tasks">Offene Aufgaben und Wunschliste</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Hier ist eine Liste mit offenen Aufgaben, die wir aus Mangel an Zeit und
+  F&auml;higkeiten nicht alle selbst angehen k&ouml;nnen. Wir brauchen
+  <i>definitiv</i> Ihre Hilfe hierf&uuml;r! Wenn Sie die ben&ouml;tigten
+  Fertigkeiten besitzen und etwas Freizeit opfern k&ouml;nnen, &uuml;berlegen
+  Sie sich bitte, uns damit zu helfen. </p>
+
+  <ul>
+  <li><b>&Uuml;bersetzungen</b>.  Enigma kann noch andere Sprachen als
+      Englisch und Deutsch unterst&uuml;tzen.  Wenn Sie uns helfen wollen,
+      Enigma an Ihre Landessprache anzupassen, kontaktieren Sie uns bitte.
+      Dies betrifft nicht nur die Kn&ouml;pfe und Levels in Engima, sondern
+      auch die Handb&uuml;cher, FAQ, Enigma-Wiki und diese
+      Webseite. (&Uuml;bersetzungen in verschiedene Mundarten sind ebenso
+      interessant!) <i>Einfach</i></li>
+      
+  <li><b>Bessere Grafiken</b>.  Wie Ihnen vielleicht aufgefallen ist, mangelt
+      es uns zur Zeit etwas an K&uuml;nstlern.  Wenn Sie mehr Talent haben als
+      wir, w&uuml;rden wir nur zu gerne unsere Sprites, Logos und alle
+      weiteren Bilder gegen bessere austauschen. <i>Einfach-Mittelschwer</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Netzwerk-Spiel</b>.  Dies ist ein gro&szlig;es und nicht-triviales
+      Unterfangen.  Wenn Sie Herausforderungen m&ouml;gen und etwas Erfahrung
+      in der Netzwerk-Programmierung mitbringen, nehmen Sie bitte Kontakt mit
+      uns auf. <i>Schwer</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Level-Editor</b>.  Dies wurde schon von vielen Nutzern angefragt, und
+      w&auml;re in der Tat eine wichtige Erg&auml;nzung. Es ist eine gute
+      Menge Arbeit, aber nicht zu schwer. Die Verwendung von Java erscheint
+      uns hierf&uuml;r sinnvoll, aber Sie k&ouml;nnen auch auf einem der
+      vorhandenen Editoren aufbauen. (Naja, Mac-Nutzer w&uuml;rden auch gerne
+      einen Editor benutzen.) <i>Mittelschwer</i></li>
+      
+  <li><b>Levels</b>.  Wir suchen unabl&auml;ssig nach (guten) Levels. Obwohl
+      es derzeit keinen Editor f&uuml;r 1.00 gibt, ist das Programmieren von
+      Levels nicht allzu schwierig, unter Verwendung der vorhandenen
+      Werkzeuge. <i>Einfach-Mittelschwer</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Sounds</b>.  Enigmas Sounds sind zur Zeit unvollst&auml;ndig und
+      einige k&ouml;nnten (m&uuml;ssten!) aufgefrischt
+      werden. <i>Mittelschwer</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Portierungen</b>.  Obwohl Enigma bereits eine Vielzahl an Plattformen
+      abdeckt, gibt es noch immer offene Punkte: Zus&auml;tzliche Pakete
+      f&uuml;r verschiedene Linux-Distributionen, Enigma unter Visual Studio
+      kompilieren, einen weiteren aktiven Programmierer, der uns dabei hilft,
+      Fehler in der Mac-Version zu finden und zu beseitigen, exotische
+      Portierungs-Ziele wie Spielekonsolen oder
+      Handhelds. <i>Einfach-Schwer</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Homepage warten</b>.  Jemand muss neue Informationen und monatliche
+      Updates (wie die Wertungen und Statistiken) auf die Homepage setzen. Das
+      ist nicht viel Arbeit, abh&auml;ngig davon, was f&uuml;r die Homepage
+      geplant ist. Dennoch w&auml;ren wir daf&uuml;r dankbar, wenn uns jemand
+      diese Aufgabe regelm&auml;&szlig;ig abnimmt. <i>Einfach</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Tech-Support</b>.  Je gr&ouml;&szlig;er Enigmas Quellcode wird, desto
+      mehr technische Fragen und Probleme treten auf mag-heut.net und der
+      Entwickler-ML zu Tage. Manchmal bedeutet das, monatlich die immer gleichen
+      Antworten zu geben, manchmal wirklich haarige Bug-Jagden und manchmal
+      einfach nur die Weiterleitung des Problems an die richtige Person. Wir
+      w&auml;ren froh, wenn jemand, der auch fremden Code verstehen kann, uns
+      mit dieser Aufgabe hilft. <i>Einfach-Mittelschwer</i></li>
+
+  <li><b>Juristische Unterst&uuml;tzung</b>. Wir versuchen Enigma
+      GPL-kompatibel zu halten. Allerdings sind Lizenzen manchmal schwer zu
+      interpretieren und schwierig zu kombinieren - und wir haben uns
+      tats&auml;chlich schon an einigen &Auml;rgernissen dieser Art
+      angesto&szlig;en. Wir w&uuml;nschen uns daf&uuml;r eine Kontaktperson,
+      die wei&szlig;, wie man Kunst und Software anderer Lizenzen in unser
+      Projekt einbinden kann. <i>Mittelschwer</i></li>
+  </ul>
+
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
+  <a name="level">Levelprogrammierung</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Obwohl Enigma keinen Leveleditor einschlie&szlig;t und Sie sich
+  m&ouml;glicherweise in die einfache Skriptsprache Lua einarbeiten
+  m&uuml;ssen, ist das Entwickeln eines Levels einfacher als es zun&auml;chst
+  vielleicht den Anschein hat.</p>
+  
+  <p>Enigmas <a href="$$refman$$">Referenzhandbuch</a> erkl&auml;rt
+  detailliert das Levelformat und alle Spielobjekte, die Sie verwenden
+  k&ouml;nnen. Sie sollten zumindest die Kapitel 1-3 &uuml;berfliegen und
+  daran denken, dass Sie Details &uuml;ber jedes Objekt hier nachschlagen
+  k&ouml;nnen.<p>
+  
+  <p>F&uuml;r Ihre ersten Experimente und als praktische Hilfe zur
+  Levelprogrammierung sollten Sie auch einen Blick auf das <a
+  href="$$wiki$$">Enigma-Wiki</a> werfen. Es konzentriert sich auf die
+  h&auml;ufigsten Features und gibt Ihnen wertvolle Codeausschnitte f&uuml;r
+  einige Standardprobleme an die Hand.</p>
+  
+  <p>Sie finden nat&uuml;rlich auch auf der <a
+  href="$$development$$#maillist">Entwickler-Mailingliste</a> und im <a
+  href="http://www.mag-heut.net">Forum</a> Hilfe.
+  Sobald Sie denken, dass Ihr Level fertig ist, setzen Sie das XML-Attribut
+  &quot;status&quot; auf &quot;stable&quot; und ver&ouml;ffentlichen Sie den
+  Level auf der Mailingliste und/oder dem Forum. Die Spieler dort werden Ihren
+  Level testen und kommentieren. Wenn keine Abk&uuml;rzungen gefunden werden
+  und damit die Entwicklung des Levels beendet ist, sollten Sie den Status auf
+  &quot;released&quot; stellen und die Version erneut ver&ouml;ffentlichen.
+  Wir sammeln die Levels aus diesen Quellen und werden Sie bei verbleibenden
+  Fragen kontaktieren.</p>
+  
+<h3><a class="arrowup" href="$$development$$"><img src="$$imagedir$$/nav_up.gif" border="0" title="back to top"></a>
+  <a name="app">Programmierung der Anwendung &quot;Enigma&quot;</a></h3>
+
+  <p>Wenn Sie die neuste Entwicklerversion von Enigma herunterladen wollen,
+  m&uuml;ssen Sie den Quelltext aus dem <a
+  href="https://developer.berlios.de/svn/?group_id=3972">Subversion Repository
+  bei Berlios</a> auschecken. F&uuml;r anonymen Zugriff, rufen Sie einfach 
+  <pre>svn checkout svn://svn.berlios.de/enigma-game/trunk</pre>
+  auf, um die aktuelle Revision des n&auml;chsten gro&szlig;en Release
+  herunterzuladen. Bitte beachten Sie dabei, dass diese nur einen
+  Schnappschuss in der Entwicklung darstellt, und die Revision sicherlich
+  unvollst&auml;ndig und sogar instabil sein kann.</p>
+  
+  <p>Das Repository enth&auml;lt mehrere Zweige des Projekts:
+  <table class="repository">
+  <tr><td class="path">/trunk</td><td>n&auml;chstes gro&szlig;es Release (1.1)</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/branches/1.0</td><td>n&auml;chstes kleines Release (1.01)</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/branches/eval</td><td>aktuell stabiles Release (1.00)
+  mit Auswertungssoftware f&uuml;r die Spielergebnisse</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/tags/0.92</td><td>stabiles 0.92 Release</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/tags/1.00</td><td>stabiles 1.00 Release</td></tr>
+  <tr><td class="path">/homepage</td><td>Raten Sie mal.</td></tr>
+  </table>
+  
+  Sie erhalten einen aktuellen &Uuml;berblick &uuml;ber die existierenden
+  Zweige mittels <a href="http://svn.berlios.de/wsvn/enigma-game">Berlios
+  WebSVN</a>.</p>
+  
+  <p>F&uuml;r die Entwicklungsarbeiten empfehlen wir eine Unix-Plattform zur
+  Kompilation. Dort erfolgen Kompilierung und Installation einfach durch:
+  
+  <pre>./autogen.sh && ./configure && make && make install</pre>
+
+  <p>F&uuml;r Informationen, wie man die Anwendung f&uuml;r Windows
+  kompiliert, lesen Sie die Datei:
+  
+  <pre>doc/README.mingw32</pre>
+  </p>
+  
+  <p>Bitte kontaktieren Sie uns &uuml;ber die <a
+  href="$$development$$#maillist">Mailingliste</a>, falls Sie Schreibzugriff
+  f&uuml;r das Repository ben&ouml;tigen.</p>
+

Deleted: homepage/input/scores.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/input/scores.html	2007-02-26 21:30:20 UTC (rev 622)
+++ homepage/input/scores.html	2007-02-26 22:19:59 UTC (rev 623)
@@ -1,29 +0,0 @@
-<h3>Score Registration</h3>
-
-<p>Starting with Enigma 1.00 beta you can register your scores.</p>
-
-<p>First you need to choose a unique user name in the options menu. Please 
-look at the <a href="$$users$$">users list</a> if your favorite name is not in
-use by someone else.</p>
-
-<p>For registration of your scores just send us your 'enigma.score' file that
-is located at your 'user path' as described in the manual. Please send this file 
-to <a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a> with
-subject 'score - username'.</p>
-
-<p> The scores are evaluated on a monthly base. Please do not send your score file
-after every good score that you achieved. Once at the end of the month is
-sufficient. The first score collection date is the 4th December 2006. Afterwards
-it is always the end of a month.
-
-<p>The updated statistics will be downloaded to your computer if you set the
-ratings update option to 'Auto'. Enigma will peek the server only a few times
-per month, independent how often you start the application. The network traffic
-is very low as just increments are downloaded and you will receive all updates
-within a few days.</p>
-
-<p>If you play most times offline and set the update option to 'Never' you may
-manually download the ratings update file
-<a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
-Extract the file from the zip and copy it to your 'user path' aside your
-'enigma.score' file.</p>

Deleted: homepage/input/scores_de.html
===================================================================
--- homepage/input/scores_de.html	2007-02-26 21:30:20 UTC (rev 622)
+++ homepage/input/scores_de.html	2007-02-26 22:19:59 UTC (rev 623)
@@ -1,35 +0,0 @@
-<h3>Spielergebnisse einsenden</h3>
-
-<p>Beginnend mit Enigma 1.00 Beta k&ouml;nnen Sie Ihre Spielergebnisse bei uns
-registrieren lassen.</p>
-
-<p>Dazu m&uuml;ssen Sie zun&auml;chst einen eindeutigen Benutzernamen
-w&auml;hlen und im Optionsmen&uuml; einstellen. Bitte lesen Sie daf&uuml;r die
-<a href="$$users$$">Spielerliste</a>, damit Sie sich keinen bereits
-vergebenen Namen ausw&auml;hlen.</p>
-
-<p>F&uuml;r eine Registrierung Ihrer Ergebnisse schicken Sie uns einfach die
-'enigma.score'-Datei, die sich in Ihrem 'Userpfad' befinden, wie im Handbuch
-beschrieben. Bitte senden Sie diese Datei an
-<a href="mailto:score at enigma-game.org">score at enigma-game.org</a>
-mit dem Betreff 'score - username'.</p>
-
-<p>Die Ergebnisse werden etwa monatlich ausgewertet. Bitte senden Sie uns
-nicht ihre Ergebnisse nach jedem guten Spiel; es reicht jeweils einmal gegen
-Ende des Monats aus. Die erste Auswertung hat am 4.Dezember 2006
-erfolgt. Sp&auml;ter wird gegen Ende eines Monats ausgewertet.</p>
-
-<p>Die erneuerten Statistiken werden von Enigma automatisch heruntergeladen,
-falls Sie im Optionsmen&uuml; die 'Update Bewertungen'-Einstellung auf 'Auto'
-geschaltet haben. Enigma wird ein paar Mal im Monat den Server nach neuen
-Statistiken befragen, unabh&auml;ngig davon, wie oft Sie Enigma starten. Die
-Netzwerkbelastung ist dabei ziemlich gering, da nur Erg&auml;nzungen
-heruntergeladen werden, und Sie erhalten die neuen Updates innerhalb einiger
-Tage.</p>
-
-<p>Falls Sie die meiste Zeit offline spielen und 'Update Bewertungen' auf
-'Nie' gestellt haben, k&ouml;nnen Sie die neuen Statistiken auch manuell
-herunterladen:
-<a href="http://www.nongnu.org/enigma/ratings/ratings.xml.zip">ratings.xml</a>.
-Entpacken Sie diese gezippte Datei und kopieren Sie sie in ihren 'Userpfad',
-in dem sich auch ihre 'enigma.score'-Datei befindet.</p>
